Both the European Council and the Council, as European institutions, are beneficiaries of the EU's general budget and, accordingly, they must answer to the citizens, thus not understanding, so far, the Council's failure to pronounce on the observations European Parliament, on the tendency of previous years to increase the under-utilization of appropriations and the carry-over of commitments. At the same time, there is another set of outstanding issues, related to the failure to provide the annual activity report of both institutions - which tarnishes and destroys the reputation and credibility of all European institutions. In addition, the failure to comply with the recommendation for the separation of the European Council and the Council, as has been proposed in recent discharge resolutions, and the lack of information on the costs of buildings and real estate projects underway, among others, are also facts. worrying. In view of the above and the content of the other observations contained in the report, I voted to refuse discharge for the execution of the budget of these two institutions for the financial year 2014.

name: Lola Sánchez Caldentey (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- In relation to the European Council and the Council, I vote in favor (rejecting the download and approval of accounts) given the lack of cooperation from this institution and its opacity.The report is in favor of rejecting his accounts, as has been customary in the last times that his management has been assessed.I vote with the majority of Parliament, which in recent times has rejected the management of the European Council and the Council.

name: Sven Schulze (PPE)
text: written.- I voted against the discharge of the general budget of the EU - European Council and Council - because there was only a lack of cooperation with the discharge authority.

name: Maria Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- The European Council and the Council still do not present separate accounts, an annual report on their activities or clearly answer questions from the parliamentary committee on budgets.I consider this lack of transparency to be inadmissible, which is why I have refused the 2014 discharge.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Parliament’s interpretation of Article 319 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union clearly sees a distinction in the two institutions’ role. Parliament has an institutional power in the Treaty to grant discharge.

name: Monika Smolková (S&D)
text: in writing. - I have already supported the second discharge report for the 2014 budget of the European Council and the Council, and like the rapporteur, I agree not to grant discharge to these institutions. Although there is a long-standing dispute between the European Parliament and the Council over the interpretation of budgetary powers, the Treaties clearly stipulate that Parliament has the power to grant discharge, with the Council making only a recommendation. In addition, the Council is not willing to cooperate with Parliament and has not yet commented on the comments made in April this year. Not only does Parliament lack an explanation for the growing level of unused funds and carry-overs, but it has also not received the Council's annual activity report. Proposals to separate the budgets of the European Council and the Council were also not considered. The Council is also spending considerable resources on its new Europe building. Its completion has been delayed, but Parliament does not have enough information on the costs incurred or the progress made. The expenditure of the Council should be controllable in the same way as the expenditure of the other institutions. In addition, it is striking that the Council has still not adopted its code of conduct and joined the Transparency Register. It is transparency and the right of citizens to information that are key factors in the credibility of the European institutions. This discrepancy should finally be closed and the Council should provide all the necessary documents to enable its budgetary implementation to be checked responsibly.

name: Ivan Štefanec (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European Parliament, as the only European institution directly elected by the citizens, has a legitimate right to scrutinize the management and operation of the European Council and the European Commission.Citizens often turn to Members individually, as well as to Parliament as a whole, with questions about the management of the European institutions' finances, and we are unable to give them adequate answers because we do not have adequate information.Also in order to increase citizens' confidence in the European Union, this incomprehensible approach of our partners must change in the future.

name: Beatrix von Storch (EFDD)
text: written.- I did not agree to the resolution of the EU Parliament on the "Discharge for the implementation of the general budget of the European Union for the financial year 2014, Section II - European Council and Council".The Council refuses any budgetary control, so that the EU Parliament has rightly refused to grant discharge.

name: Patricija Šulin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the second discharge report on the implementation of the European Union general budget for the financial year 2014, Section II - European Council and Council.We cannot give a discharge to the Secretary-General of the Council on the implementation of the budget, as many issues remain open.From the fact that the European Council and the Council have not submitted their annual activity report to the European Parliament, which is unacceptable, to the fact that the budgets of the European Council and the Council have not yet been separated, as recommended by the European Parliament in recent discharge resolutions.In any case, if we want effective budgetary control, we must ensure the necessary cooperation between the Council and the European Parliament.

name: Νεοκλής Συλικιώτης (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- We voted in favor of this report, as the Council refuses to respond adequately to the additional expenditure incurred in 2014. We believe that all EU institutions must be audited transparently, adequately and on an equal footing with respect to their budgets.

name: Ελευθέριος Συναδινός (NI)
text: in writing.- The reported data must be sufficient, accompanied by actions to correct previous observations, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014.

name: Tibor Szanyi (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the report refusing to grant the Secretary-General of the Council discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Council and the Council for the financial year 2014. Like the report, I find it regrettable that the European Council and the Council do not submit their annual activity reports to Parliament. This is unacceptable and also detrimental to the reputation of the EU institutions. Furthermore, it is not acceptable that the budgets of the European Council and the Council have not yet been separated, as recommended by Parliament in recent discharge resolutions. I urge the Council to remedy the shortcomings identified in the report, especially with regard to the answers given to Parliament. From now on, I also look forward to being briefed by the Council on the process of modernizing its administration, in particular its expected impact on the Council's budget.

name: Marc Tarabella (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the discharge.I would like to take advantage of this explanation of vote to underline my disappointment at the fact that the European Council and the Council do not present their annual activity report to Parliament.This is unacceptable and it damages the reputation of the institutions of the European Union!

name: Pavel Telička (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ The second report on the implementation of the general budget of the European Union for the financial year 2014 outlines the use of the general budget for 2014. The report aims to afford insight into the EU budget mechanism and how the budget was managed and spent in 2014, including the different expenses of the European institutions. I voted in favour of the report, calling on Parliament to refuse to grant the Secretary-General of the Council discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Council and of the Council for the financial year 2014. The absence of the annual activity report is detrimental to the reputation, integrity and transparency of all the EU institutions.

name: Ruža Tomašić (ECR)
text: written.- I supported the report refusing to give discharge to the European Union budget in the area of the European Council and the Council for 2014, because I believe that no discharge can be given to any part of the European Union budget until the Court of Auditors gives a positive report for the general budget as a whole.In addition, the European Council and the Council do not submit an annual report on their activities to the European Parliament, and accordingly there are no data on building costs or progress reports on construction projects and a detailed overview of the costs so far.I support the call for the Council to provide information on the process of modernizing the administration and in particular on the expected impact of modernization on the Council's budget.If, in the opinion of the Court of Auditors, all the above conditions are not met, I believe that, due to a lack of transparency, the European Parliament must not give discharge to the general budget of the European Council and the Council for 2014.

name: Romana Tomc (PPE)
text: in writing. - I supported the proposal for a decision on discharge in respect of the implementation of the European Union general budget for the financial year 2014, Section II - European Council and Council. All Union institutions should operate in a transparent manner and be fully accountable to Union citizens for the use of the funds entrusted to them as Union institutions. The European Council and the Council, as institutions of the Union, should be democratically accountable to the citizens of the Union, as they receive funding from the general budget of the European Union. According to Article 335 TFEU […], in matters relating to the operation of individual institutions, the Union shall be represented by each institution on the basis of its administrative autonomy ", which means that, subject to Article 55 of Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 1605/2002. 966/2012 (Financial Regulation), the institutions are each individually responsible for implementing their own budget. The European Council and the Council have not submitted their annual activity report to Parliament, which is unacceptable and damages the reputation of the EU institutions. The fact that the Council did not forward the requested documents to Parliament undermines in particular the right of Union citizens to information and transparency and becomes a cause for concern, as it testifies to a certain democratic deficit in the Union institutions.

name: Estefanía Torres Martínez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- In relation to the European Council and the Council, I vote in favor (rejecting the download and approval of accounts) given the lack of cooperation from this institution and its opacity.The report is in favor of rejecting his accounts, as has been customary in the last times that his management has been assessed.I vote with the majority of Parliament, which in recent times has rejected the management of the European Council and the Council.

name: Kazimierz Michał Ujazdowski (ECR)
text: in writing. - The European Parliament put to the vote its final report on the implementation of the budget of the European Council and the Council for the financial year 2014. At this stage of the procedure, Parliament could either grant discharge or refuse discharge. I voted in favor of the latter for several reasons. The Council and the European Council were not involved in the discharge process. Neither institution has submitted its annual activity report to Parliament. We also did not receive transparent data on the costs incurred for construction investments and administrative modernization. The Court of Auditors has not issued a declaration of assurance on the implementation of the EU budget as a whole. The European Council and the Council as beneficiaries of the general budget must act transparently. They are accountable to citizens for how they manage the funds entrusted to them. I supported the report, which was refused discharge, and voted in favor of the resolution.

name: Miguel Urbán Crespo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- In relation to the European Council and the Council, I vote in favor (rejecting the download and approval of accounts) given the lack of cooperation from this institution and its opacity.The report is in favor of rejecting his accounts, as has been customary in the last times that his management has been assessed.I vote with the majority of Parliament, which in recent times has rejected the management of the European Council and the Council.

name: Ivo Vajgl (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the second report on discharge in respect of the implementation of the general budget of the European Union for the financial year 2014, Section II – European Council and Council. All Union institutions ought to be transparent and fully accountable to the citizens of the Union for the funds entrusted to them. The European Council and the Council, as Union institutions, should be democratically accountable to the citizens of the Union as far as they are beneficiaries of the general budget of the Union. The report underlines that an effective budgetary control exercise requires the cooperation of Parliament and the Council. I voted in favour because I believe that the European Council’s and the Council’s lack of cooperation with the discharge authority sends a negative signal to the citizens of the Union.

name: Ángela Vallina (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- The European Council and the Council still do not present separate accounts, an annual report on their activities or clearly answer questions from the parliamentary committee on budgets.I consider this lack of transparency to be inadmissible, which is why I have refused the 2014 discharge.

name: Derek Vaughan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Parliament’s interpretation of Article 319 TFEU clearly sees a distinction between the two institutions’ roles. Parliament has an institutional power in the Treaty to grant discharge. The Council has again refused to provide the Parliament with its annual activity report, and the Parliament has reiterated its call on the Council to provide the information needed for the discharge.

name: Hilde Vautmans (ALDE)
text: written.- The European Parliament cannot grant discharge to the Secretary-General of the Council in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Council and the Council for the financial year 2014 due to the lack of information.For example, the Council has still not responded to the comments made by Parliament in its discharge resolution of 28 April 2016 on the trend of increasing under-execution and carry-overs of appropriations from previous years.The Parliament regrets that the European Council and the Council do not submit their annual activity report to Parliament, calling this inadmissible and damaging the reputation of the EU institutions.For example, only three of the twenty-seven questions submitted by the members of the Committee on Budgetary Control to the Council in connection with the 2014 financial year have been clearly answered.The European Parliament takes its role of budget controller seriously.

name: Miguel Viegas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- As the Council has not yet commented on the observations made by Parliament in its discharge resolution of 28 April 2016 on the trend of previous years towards an increase in under-utilization of appropriations and in the carry-over of commitments, they have not provided thePE your annual activity report, we follow the proposal to not give discharge.

name: Harald Vilimsky (ENF)
text: written.- The motion for a resolution criticizes the lack of transparency in connection with the activity reports of the European Council and the Council of the EU and the information on the costs of construction projects.It is also noted that Parliament does not have sufficient information to be able to make an informed decision on granting discharge, and that difficulties have therefore repeatedly arisen in previous discharge procedures due to the lack of cooperation on the part of the Council.The Council's unwillingness to cooperate with the discharge authority and provide Parliament with the documents requested is undermining the citizens' right to information and transparency.I see this as a serious democratic deficit in the institutions of the Union and I have therefore approved the motion.

name: Iuliu Winkler (PPE)
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of the report by the European Parliament refusing to grant the Secretary-General of the Council discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Council and the Council for the financial year 2014. The resolution annexed to the report states that the EPand considers that this is inadmissible and is detrimental to the reputation of the EU institutions.It also regrets that the budget of the European Council and that of the Council have not yet been separated, as recommended by Parliament in recent resolutions on discharge.The European Parliament is of the opinion that the lack of cooperation between the European Council and the Council with the discharge authority is a negative signal for the citizens of the Union.

name: Auke Zijlstra (ENF)
text: written.- The PVV voted against discharge of the budget of the European Council and the Council.The PVV is of the opinion that it is not within the powers of the European Parliament to discharge the budget of the European Council.That is what the national parliaments of the member states are about.Abstaining from discharge of the budget by the EP is therefore fine.The PVV can therefore understand that the Council believes that it does not have to comply with the budgetary rules of the EP.But that does not mean that the PVV approves the budget.

name: Jana Žitňanská (ECR)
text: in writing.- I did not support the report on discharge in respect of the implementation of the European Union general budget for the financial year 2014, for the sections of the budget of the European Council and the Council.This is the second discharge report, and in the first report we voted to postpone it in April this year.As with the first report of April this year, I voted in favor of this report in the belief that the discharge should only be granted once the budget as such has been approved by the Court of Auditors.However, as this has not yet been the case for the 2014 budget, I voted against the discharge.

name: Milan Zver (PPE)
text: in writing.- I supported the European Parliament's decision of 27 October 2016 on discharge in respect of the implementation of the European Union general budget for the financial year 2014, Section II - European Council and Council.I agree that no discharge should be given to the Secretary-General of the Council in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Council and of the Council for the financial year 2014. Due to non-cooperation, Parliament cannot take an informed decision on discharge.Effective budgetary control requires the cooperation of Parliament and the Council in order to maintain transparency and democratic accountability to Union taxpayers.It was noted that only three of the 27 questions submitted to the Council by the members of the Committee on Budgetary Control in relation to the financial year 2014 received a clear answer in the documents submitted by the Council in the discharge procedure.

name: Isabella Adinolfi (EFDD)
text: in writing.- The Court of Auditors has expressed, for four consecutive years, a qualified opinion on the regularity of budgetary operations in the ENIAC.Furthermore, the audit studies carried out present three different methods of carrying out, not allowing a global evaluation and comparison.Due to the lack of sufficient elements and while supporting the content of the report, I voted no for the discharge.

name: Tim Aker (EFDD)
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ENIAC. Discharge is a procedure whereby the European Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ENIAC (European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Council) is a research programme aimed at the integration and miniaturisation of devices and increasing their functionalities. ENIAC is set up as a private-public partnership, bringing together the EU Commission and the Member and Associated States. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 356 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 000. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayers’ money.

name: Marina Albiol Guzmán (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of nanotechnological knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.Said knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee its exclusive exploitation.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in nanotechnology, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Martina Anderson Lynn Boylan and Liadh Ní Riada (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was asked to provide further information to the Committee on Budgetary Control on the reliability of its accounts and the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions. The replies provided by the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the ENIAC Joint Undertaking) were considered to be satisfactory. I therefore voted in favour of ENIAC’s closure of accounts for 2014 and in favour of the resolution.

name: Νίκος Ανδρουλάκης (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the Second Report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking budget for the financial year 2014, because I support the actions of such Joint Undertakings in various fields, which offer many benefits to the daily lives of European citizens.

name: Marie-Christine Arnautu (ENF)
text: in writing. - The report calls for discharge for the implementation of the budget. If the financial commitments come mainly from external contributors, the Court notes a lack of seriousness in the follow-up of the recommendations received from the internal audit service of the Commission, the joint undertaking tending to continue to ignore possible optimization of its internal audit. The report nevertheless notes that the Joint Undertaking has received guarantees from the national authorities concerned on the reliability and regularity of its operations. While the report mentions the need to review the management of the Joint Undertaking, many audits are in progress, after the internal investigation of which it was the subject in 2015. If they tend to show that the national procedures provide reasonable assurance of legality and regularity of operations, the Court noted the absence of practical arrangements for ex post audits of the Joint Undertaking. This does not guarantee to follow its management with precision. Thus she has expressed reservations on her accounts for the fourth consecutive year. I therefore opposed this report.

name: Jonathan Arnott (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ This decision is to grant discharge and close the accounts of ENIAC (European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Council). It is a research programme aimed at enhancing the further integration and miniaturisation of devices and increasing their functionalities. ENIAC is set up as a public-private partnership, bringing together the Commission and European Member and Associated States. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 356 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 250.

name: Jean Arthuis (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report as recommended by the committee responsible in its second reading, taking into account the receipt of additional evidence to justify and close the accounts on the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the'fiscal year 2014.

name: Zigmantas Balčytis (S&D)
text: in writing.- 2007December 20The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was set up for a period of ten years to develop and implement a research agenda for the development of key nanoelectronics technologies in a wide range of applications.The financial statements of the Joint Undertaking for the year 2014 have been presented in all material respects in accordance with the provisions of its rules and the accounting rules approved by the Commission's Accounting Officer.However, I agree with the Court of Auditors, which for the fourth consecutive year issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions in its annual accounts for 2014, on the grounds that the administrative arrangements with national funding bodiesex post audit procedures.

name: Gerard Batten (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ENIAC. Discharge is a procedure whereby the European Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ENIAC (European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Council) is a research programme aimed at the integration and miniaturisation of devices and increasing their functionalities. ENIAC is set up as a private-public partnership, bringing together the EU Commission and Member and Associated States. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 356 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 000. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayers’ money.

name: Nicolas Bay (ENF)
text: in writing.- The ENIAC Joint Undertaking is very light-hearted in its management, refusing to closely follow recommendations received from the Commission's internal audit service.The European Court of Auditors noted the absence of practical arrangements for ex-post audits of the Joint Undertaking, which does not guarantee to monitor its management with precision and this is the fourth year in a row that the Court has issuedreservations on its accounts.I therefore voted against granting discharge for the implementation of its budget.

name: Hugues Bayet (S&D)
text: in writing.- In accordance with the proposal of the Committee on Budgetary Control, I voted in favor of the discharge for ENIAC for the financial year 2014.

name: Brando Benifei (S&D)
text: in writing.- The budget discharge procedure represents an important moment in the institutional life of the European Union.On this occasion, the European Parliament, the only institution elected by universal suffrage by the citizens, decides on the recommendation of the Council whether or not to guarantee the final approval of the implementation of the budget for a given financial year.This is a fundamental step which is also an opportunity to address specific recommendations to the institutions and agencies that make up the structure of the Union.Following the guidance of the Committee on Budgetary Control (CONT), today I decided to vote in favor of the Marinescu report granting discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (former ENIAC Joint Undertaking and ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking) for implementationof the Joint Undertaking's budget for the financial year 2014.

name: Xabier Benito Ziluaga (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In spring, both technology companies, publicly financed, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Izaskun Bilbao Barandica (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report on the 2014 discharge of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, formerly called ENIAC.The accounts faithfully present the results in their significant aspects, for which I have supported the approval of their management.

name: Dominique Bilde (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this report which recommends granting discharge to ENIAC for the implementation of its budget for the 2014 financial year. The observation made by the Court of Auditors and taken up by Parliament's rapporteur is clear: fewserious in following up on previous recommendations provided by the Commission, no internal audit report provided by ENIAC in 2014;two massive irregularities in the management of this joint venture.From a purely budgetary point of view, it can be recalled that the initial budget for 2014 only included commitment appropriations for operating costs, amounting to EUR 2 300 000, and that the budget did not provide for appropriations for'commitment intended for operational activities.In addition, it was noted that the rate of use of administrative commitment appropriations was only 43%.A real budgetary waste that deserves to be highlighted and reformed.

name: Mara Bizzotto (ENF)
text: in writing.- The report on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 has strong critical elements which convinced me not to support the text with my vote.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: written.- I voted for the discharge of the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the ENIAC Joint Undertaking and the Artemis Joint Undertaking) on the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, in view of thereport prepared by the Committee on Budgetary Control, which confirms that the accounts of the Joint Undertaking accurately present, in all their significant aspects, its financial situation.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report, which deals with the 2014 Discharge: for the ENIAC Joint Undertaking. 2007 December 20 The ENIAC Joint Undertaking (hereinafter referred to as "the Joint Undertaking") was set up for a period of ten years to develop and implement a research agenda for the development of key nanoelectronics technologies in a wide range of applications. Since 2010 July. The Joint Undertaking has been granted financial autonomy. The founding members of this Joint Undertaking are the Union, represented by the Commission, Belgium, Germany, Estonia, Ireland, Greece, Spain, France, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Sweden, the United Kingdom and the European Nanoelectronics Association. The European Parliament acknowledges that the Joint Undertaking's financial statements for 2014 January 1 - 2014 June 26 its financial position in 2014 June 26 and the results of operations and cash flows relating to the period ended on that date are presented in all material respects in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules approved by the Commission's accounting officer. Parliament therefore approves the closure of the accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Franc Bogovič (PPE)
text: in writing.- I support the discharge to the Director in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, as the European Parliament has noted that the Joint Undertaking's accounts for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 201426 June 2014 and its profit or loss and cash flows for the period then ended, in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and accounting rules.

name: Biljana Borzan (S&D)
text: written.- I support this 2014 Discharge Report for the ENIAC Joint Undertaking.Joint Undertakings bring together industries and research bodies into public-private partnerships to support research, new technologies and demonstration activities, and accelerate the market introduction of individual technologies.Domains include air traffic control, carbon energy, nanotechnology, computer technology, cleaner aviation technology, and nuclear fusion.I support JUS in its many areas of work that are beneficial to EU citizens.

name: Marie-Christine Boutonnet (ENF)
text: in writing.- This report advocates granting discharge for the execution of the budget of this Joint Undertaking, while at the same time, it raises serious doubts about the sincerity of its accounts, for the fourth consecutive year.I am therefore voting against this report.

name: Renata Briano (S&D)
text: in writing. - Parliament grants discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (former ENIAC Joint Undertaking and ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget for the financial year 2014 and approves the closure of the accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the year 2014. Acknowledges that the Joint Undertaking's accounts for the period 1 January-26 June 2014 faithfully present the financial position of the enterprise as well as the results of its operations and cash flows. However, the Parliament is concerned that the Court of Auditors has issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the transactions underlying the accounts, as the administrative arrangements concluded with the National Financing Authorities (NFAs) do not contain detailed rules. practices for carrying out ex post audits. Parliament noted that no conclusions could be drawn on the effective functioning of ex post audits and calls on ECSEL to provide reasonable assurance on the legality and regularity of transactions, regretting the lack of available information on contributions in kind and cash contributions and calling on the Court to include in its future reports specific provisions relating to the assessment procedure and the level of contributions in kind and in cash.

name: Steeve Briois (ENF)
text: in writing.- The report calls for discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking.However, this report is rather harsh on the management of the Union's contribution, which amounted to nearly 450 million euros over 10 years.Despite the guarantees of reliability and regularity given by the national authorities concerned, I voted against the report granting budgetary discharge.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: signed up. - The ENIAC Joint Undertaking has a key role to play, being established in 2007 for a period of 10 years, with the main objective of developing and implementing a research agenda to develop key skills in the field of nanoelectronics for different application sectors. Following the audits carried out, it was found that the ENIAC Joint Undertaking has accounts which provide a true and fair view of the financial situation and results of its operations, as well as the cash flows for the financial year 2014, in accordance with its financial rules. I spoke in favor of the discharge report for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, as I believe that this undertaking managed the funds available in an efficient and transparent manner, constantly pursuing the purpose for which it was established.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of the report concerning the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 as the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the reporting period faithfully present its financial position as of 26 June 2014. The reliability of the accounts, as well as the legality and regularity of the related transactions, is attested by the declaration presented by the Court of Auditors for the financial year 2014, pursuant to Article 287 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union. However, the Court's report shows that the Joint Undertaking did not assess the quality of the audit reports submitted by the national funding authorities concerning the costs related to completed projects. Due to the different methodologies used by the NFAs, it was not possible to draw conclusions about the effectiveness of the functioning of the ex post audits. Indeed, these did not allow the joint venture to calculate a weighted error rate or a residual error rate. According to the Court's report, the final budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 includes commitment appropriations of € 2,356,000 and payment appropriations of € 76,500,250.

name: Matt Carthy (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was asked to provide further information to the Committee on Budgetary Control on the reliability of its accounts and the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions. The replies provided by the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the ENIAC Joint Undertaking) were considered to be satisfactory. I therefore voted in favour of ENIAC’s closure of accounts for 2014 and in favour of the resolution.

name: James Carver (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ENIAC. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ENIAC (European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Council) is a research programme aimed at the integration and miniaturisation of devices and increasing their functionalities. ENIAC is set up as a private-public partnership, bringing together the EU Commission and the Member and Associated States. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 356 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 000. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: David Casa (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of granting discharge to the joint undertaking for the implementation of the joint technology initiative on nanoelectronics following the postponement of this decision due to the Court of Auditors’ opinion to do so following a lack of information supporting the statement that the implementation of national procedures provided enough assurance as to the legality and regularity of the transactions.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing. - The Court of Auditors, in its report on the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January to 26 June 2014, issued for the fourth consecutive year a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the transactions underlying the accounts. Furthermore, following an evaluation of the audit strategies of three national funding authorities, it was not possible to draw conclusions on the effective functioning of the ex post audits due to the different methodologies used. These shortcomings led to the failure to grant discharge in the first instance: as in reality the ENIAC Joint Undertaking and the Artemis Joint Undertaking were merged in 2014 to create the Joint Technology Initiative "Electronic Components and Systems for European Leadership" (ITC ECSEL), these shortcomings cannot in any way be resolved (in fact ENIAC no longer exists). For this reason, while supporting the content of this resolution, we together with the M5S delegation voted against granting discharge.

name: Λευτέρης Χριστοφόρου (PPE)
text: in writing.- We approve the closure of the accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 and congratulate the rapporteur of the report.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. - I grant discharge for the implementation of the budget to the Executive Director of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking given the importance of implementing a Joint Technology Initiative (JTI) on nanoelectronics. Indeed, it is a research program aimed at enhancing the integration and miniaturization of devices and the consequent increase in their functionality. The ENIAC is therefore configured as a public-private partnership, which brings together the European Commission and the European States and the States associated with AENEAS, the association that represents research and development operators in the nanoelectronics sector (Corporate, SME , research institutes and universities) in Europe. The EU must be a leader in cutting-edge productions in the face of a globalized world in which the volumes achieved by emerging countries would seem not to allow European companies to compete. ENIAC's 2014 budget provided for commitment appropriations of EUR 2 356 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 250, in line with what was expected, however I am concerned about the qualified opinion expressed by the Court of Auditors in its report on legitimacy and the regularity of the transactions carried out by ENIAC. I therefore hope that clarifications will be provided on this issue as soon as possible.

name: Deirdre Clune (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the second report on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 and noted no objections.

name: Carlos Coelho (PPE)
text: in writing. - The discharge referred to in this report covers the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014, the date on which the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was merged with the ENIAC Joint Undertaking, giving rise to ITC ECSEL, a joint technological initiative in the field of 'Electronic components and systems for European leadership'. I am concerned that, according to the Court of Auditors' report, it was possible to enter into administrative agreements with national funding bodies that did not include provisions on ex post audits and other considerations regarding payment appropriations. I welcome the fact that the merger of the old companies and the creation of ITC ECSEL has made it possible to ascertain the legality and regularity of the transactions, by sending relevant information by the national financing entities that ensures reasonable guarantee as to the legality and regularity of the transactions, allowing my support for this report.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. Given the positive opinion expressed by the Court of Auditors and in the absence of serious irregularities and errors, I considered it appropriate to proceed with the approval of thedocument in question.

name: Javier Couso Permuy (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of nanotechnological knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.This knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee private exploitation of it.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in nanotechnology, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Andrea Cozzolino (S&D)
text: in writing.- ENIAC represents a very important reality in the field of promoting public-private investments in the sector of nano-electric technologies in Europe.In particular, synergistic coordination between resources, EU Framework Program funds and national research and development funds, and universities, private individuals and local authorities, is needed in a key innovation sector in Europe.This report supports the legitimacy of the statements regarding results of operations and cash flows for the period under review.Furthermore, it is stressed that the national procedures concerning the legality and regularity of the transactions are defined as a reasonable guarantee according to the joint undertaking.Therefore, I am voting in favor of this text, appreciating the legality and regularity of the discharge operations carried out by ENIAC.

name: Edward Czesak (ECR)
text: in writing.- I voted against the 2014 discharge report, namely the ENIAC Joint Undertaking, with the consequence that I did not grant discharge.I do not see any progress in the project like ENIAC.I am not convinced by the arguments that the failure to grant discharge in spring 2016 was only due to a lack of information necessary to calculate the error rate for Member States' audits and a different error calculation system.For this reason, I voted against the discharge report.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of this discharge as ENIAC presented fairly to the European Court of Auditors the necessary accounts in respect of the implementation of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking’s budget for the financial year 2014. ENIAC provided the reasonable assurance on the legality and regularity of transactions and also provided reasonable assurance with regard to the legality and regularity of the national procedures. This Undertaking was set up in 2007 for a period of 10 years to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of key competences of nanoelectronics across different application areas.

name: Daniel Dalton (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to postpone discharge again on this report because the European Court of Auditors did not give the EU budget as a whole a positive statement of assurance. The level of error for the year 2014 was estimated to be 4.4%, which, whilst a slight improvement on 2013, is still too high. It is the job of Parliament to verify that the EU budget was spent in accordance with the rules and in line with the principles of sound financial management, and unfortunately the Court of Auditors found that was not the case for the year 2014. We need more simplification of key areas of financial management in the EU budget and a stronger focus on tackling parts of the budget with a higher risk of problems.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (ENF)
text: in writing. - Over the ten years of operation of the Joint Undertaking, the Union's contribution has been EUR 450 million, out of a significantly larger total. The report is quite harsh on the activities of this joint venture. While the financial commitments come mainly from external contributors, the Court notes a lack of seriousness in the follow-up to the recommendations received from the Commission's internal audit service. The joint venture does not appear determined to improve its internal audit. The report nevertheless notes that the Joint Undertaking has received guarantees from the national authorities concerned on the reliability and regularity of its operations. While the report mentions the need to review the management of the Joint Undertaking, many audits are in progress, after the internal investigation of which it was the subject in 2015. Moreover, the Court noted the absence practical arrangements for ex post audits of the Joint Undertaking. Thus she has expressed reservations on her accounts for the fourth consecutive year. Also, I voted against this discharge.

name: Γεώργιος Επιτήδειος (NI)
text: in writing.- The reported financial data must be sufficient, accompanied by actions to correct previous remarks, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective operations.

name: Jill Evans (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this discharge report. The postponement of the discharge from April has enabled action to be taken to clarify some of the issues of concern to myself and my constituents in Wales.

name: José Manuel Fernandes (PPE)
text: in writing.- ENIAC was created on December 20, 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of defining and executing a «research agenda» for the development of essential skills in the field of nanoelectronics transversal to the different areas of application having as itsmaximum contribution for the 10-year period allocated by the Union to the Joint Undertaking EUR 450 000 000 from the budget of the Seventh Framework Program for Research.The final budget for 2014 included EUR 2 356 000 in commitment appropriations and EUR 76 500 250 in payment appropriations.National guarantee procedures for countries that received 54.2% of the Joint Undertaking's grants were supervised until April 2015.

name: Edouard Ferrand (ENF)
text: in writing.- Vote against: if the report mentions the need to review the management of the joint venture, many audits are in progress, after the internal investigation of which it was the subject in 2015. If they tend to demonstratethat the national procedures provide a reasonable assurance of legality and regularity of the operations, the Court noted the absence of practical arrangements for ex-post audits of the Joint Undertaking.This does not guarantee to follow its management with precision.It therefore has reservations on its accounts for the fourth consecutive year.

name: João Ferreira (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - ENIAC was created in December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of defining and executing a “research agenda” for the development of essential skills in the field of nanoelectronics transversal to the different areas of application. ENIAC is a public-private partnership. The Court of Auditors, in its report on the annual accounts of ENIAC for the financial year 2014, published an opinion with reservations for the fourth consecutive year with regard to the regularity and legality of the underlying transactions, on the grounds that the administrative agreements signed with national donors regarding the auditing of payment requests for projects do not include the practical arrangements for ex post audits. According to the report of the Court of Auditors, ENIAC did not assess the quality of the audit reports sent by the national financing entities on the costs related to the completed projects. After evaluating the audit strategies of three national donors, it was not possible to conclude whether the ex post audits work effectively, as the different methodologies used by the national donors did not allow ENIAC to calculate a weighted error rate, nor a residual error rate.

name: Lorenzo Fontana (ENF)
text: in writing.- I am voting against the resolution.Although it has some positive points, the text is not strong enough and accompanies the decision to grant discharge.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (NI)
text: in writing.- I am voting against the second report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The financial data reported must be sufficient, together with remedial action, in order for the financial discharge to be accepted.year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective acts.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. I support the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Arne Gericke (ECR)
text: written.- I voted against the discharge of the ENIAC (European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Council) joint undertaking, because it is not clear to me why the EU should pay double-digit million amounts year after year in order to carry out the very lucrative research that an extremely financially strong industry should doto advance nanotechnology.

name: Jens Gieseke (PPE)
text: written.- I am voting in favor of the discharge of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking, as the ENIAC projects make an important contribution to research into nanoelectronics.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In the spring, both technology companies, of private public financing, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Theresa Griffin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint undertakings (JUs) bring together research and industry in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities, and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the JUs in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Antanas Guoga (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. The European Parliament granted a discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Τάκης Χατζηγεωργίου (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- We supported the discharge in terms of budget execution, as it covers additional costs incurred.

name: Marian Harkin (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to grant the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the ENIAC Joint Undertaking and the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking) discharge in respect of the implementation of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking’s budget for the financial year 2014. I accept that the intention of the joint undertaking is to continue the exercise of surveying national insurance procedures by covering up to 92.7% of the total joint undertaking grants allocated and I welcome its assurance that the national procedures provide reasonable assurance with regard to the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the second report on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, as no major irregularities were found and its financial operations proved to be consistent and sound.Also, the transactions carried out proved to be legal and regular, and I therefore support this report.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)
text: in writing.- The activities of this joint venture are singled out in this report, which highlights a lack of rigor in taking into account the recommendations of the Commission's internal audit and a lack of interest in optimizing the latter.Even if the competent national authorities have vouched for the reliability and regularity of the company's operations, the fact remains that the audits carried out reveal the absence of practical arrangements for ex-post audits of the company.company and therefore the inability to follow its management precisely.I voted against.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the discharge for the ENIAC Joint Undertaking.This vote has been refused many times, but new information provided by ENIAC now allows us to grant this discharge.The discharge was granted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: written.- For the fourth year running, the Court of Auditors issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions in its report on the annual accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking.That is why I would have voted against the discharge report.

name: Afzal Khan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint Undertakings (JUs) bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities, and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Domains covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the JUs in their many areas of work, which is of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Gilles Lebreton (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this text because it could be more critical given the criticisms leveled by the Court of Auditors on this company.

name: Marine Le Pen (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against the 2014 discharge report for the Eniac Joint Undertaking.If the report mentions the need to review the management of the joint venture, many audits are in progress, after the internal investigation of which it was the subject in 2015. If they tend to show that the national proceduresprovide a reasonable assurance of the legality and regularity of the operations, the Court noted the absence of practical arrangements for ex post audits of the Joint Undertaking, which does not guarantee that its management will be followed with precision.Thus she has expressed reservations on her accounts for the fourth consecutive year.There is a lack of seriousness in monitoring internal audit.

name: Philippe Loiseau (ENF)
text: in writing.- If the financial commitments come mainly from external contributors, the Court nevertheless notes a lack of seriousness in the follow-up of the recommendations received from the internal audit service of the Commission.The report nevertheless notes that the ENIAC Joint Undertaking has received guarantees from the national authorities concerned on the reliability and regularity of its operations.The Court noted the absence of practical arrangements for ex post audits of the Joint Undertaking, which does not guarantee that its management will be monitored with precision.Thus she has expressed reservations on her accounts for the fourth consecutive year.As the report called for discharge for the implementation of the budget, I voted against.

name: Javi López (S&D)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the discharge of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking because, although the approval was not given in April, the annual report of the Court of Auditors had indicated that the information necessary to calculate the rate oferrors, following audits carried out by Member States, as their calculation methods had changed.Additional documents sent this time by the national authorities have shown that the calculations were correct.

name: Paloma López Bermejo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of nanotechnological knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.This knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee private exploitation of it.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in nanotechnology, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: in writing.- I voted against the discharge, that is, against the approval of the final report of the EU institution ENIAC.ENIAC is a joint research institute of the Commission, Member States and nanoparticle companies.I do not agree that the Member States and the Commission should have a stake in this company.In my opinion, nanotechnology research should be a matter for private companies.

name: Monica Macovei (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I consider that compliance of the procedures implemented in the individual Member States, in and of itself, guarantees the legality of transactions underlying the ENIAC accounts. I therefore welcome the fact that the National Funding Authority, at the request of ITC ECSEL (formed by the merging of ENIAC and ARTEMIS), has demonstrated that the regularity of transactions is guaranteed by the application of the national procedures. I am confident with regard to ENIAC’s intention to cover almost all of the total grants allocated to the individual states.

name: Ivana Maletić (PPE)
text: written.- This report concludes that the financial statements of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 are presented in a credible and transparent manner in accordance with the provisions of the Joint Undertaking's financial rules and accounting rules.The closure of the accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 is hereby approved. I therefore supported this report.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (ECR)
text: in writing.- I am voting against the second report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, as it is incomplete and well-founded, as well as for the reasons given in detail in my speech to the European Parliament in Strasbourg onOctober 26, 2016.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this text.The audit focuses on the share of EU funds allocated to the Joint Undertaking.Reservations are expressed by the Court of Auditors, while the national authorities concerned approve of its effectiveness: it is not acceptable to vote the discharge for the agency on the Joint Technology Initiative for Nanoelectronics Technologies (ENIAC) insuch a vague management context.

name: Valentinas Mazuronis (ALDE)
text: in writing. - I supported the EP resolution giving discharge to ENIAC for the financial year 2014. This company was established in 2007. for a period of ten years to develop and implement a research agenda for the development of key nanoelectronics technologies in a wide range of applications. Since 2010 July. The Joint Undertaking has been granted financial autonomy. The founding members of this Joint Undertaking are the Union, represented by the Commission, Belgium, Germany, Estonia, Ireland, Greece, Spain, France, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Sweden, the United Kingdom and the European Nanoelectronics Association. The European Parliament acknowledges that the financial statements and cash flow results of the Joint Undertaking are presented in all material respects in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules approved by the Commission's Accounting Officer. Parliament therefore approves the closure of the accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- This report gives discharge for the execution of the 2014 budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking, created by the European Union to promote nanotechnology and now merged into the ESELC Joint Undertaking on Electronic Components and Systems.The report notes, however, that the Court of Auditors has expressed reservations about the regularity and legality of the financial operations of this joint venture.She noted that state audit reports on the work of this body had not been assessed or taken into account.I deplore this lack of democratic control over the budget, a fortiori on a subject as sensitive and debatable as nanotechnologies.I am therefore voting against this discharge report.

name: Nuno Melo (PPE)
text: in writing.- All European institutions that depend on the budget of the European Union must be strictly supervised by the Court of Auditors and by all entities with this function.It is necessary to assess whether Community funds are being used well, whether these institutions are complying with the objectives set and whether there is no waste of resources.In general, with few exceptions, to be assessed by the inspections that are known, we can say that the institutions in question are using the funds made available correctly and complying with the proposed objectives.I therefore vote in favor of the discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly ENIAC Joint Undertaking and Artemis Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Roberta Metsola (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: in writing.- The ENIAC company was created on December 20, 2007 with the objective of developing and implementing a research program for the development of essential skills for nanoelectronics in various fields of application, for a period often years.For my part, I have decided to vote in favor of the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the company ENIAC for the financial year 2014. Indeed, attaching great importance to the principle of transparency and openness, essential for European citizens, I believe that the accounts of ENIAC present fairly, in all their material aspects, the financial situation of the company as well as the results of its operations and cash flows.I therefore consider that this company has fulfilled its obligations.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report because joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies, which is essential. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our group supports the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: in writing.- The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was wound up in June by a Council Regulation of 6 May 2014, merging with the ECSEL Joint Undertaking and the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking.On 28 April this year, Parliament decided to postpone the discharge decision due to problems with this.In its second report, the Committee on Budgetary Control now proposes that Parliament approve the closure of the accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.I voted accordingly.

name: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar (PPE)
text: in writing.- For the reasons set out in this report, it deserves my favorable vote, in the sense of giving discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly ENIAC Joint Undertaking and Artemis Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014I argue that the observations / suggestions presented should be taken into account in the future.

name: Claude Moraes (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our group supports the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this text.The granting of discharge, initially scheduled for the plenary session in April, was postponed because ENIAC had not provided certain information necessary for this grant.This information has since been correctly communicated to the CONT Commission.Therefore, there is no longer any objection to our granting both discharges.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Each year Parliament makes a decision, following a recommendation from the Council, regarding the discharge for budget implementation, through which its releases the Commission from its responsibility for managing the given budget for a specific year by marking the end of its execution. I voted for the 2014 discharge in respect of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking, a public-private partnership focusing on nano-electronics.

name: Franz Obermayr (ENF)
text: written.- I spoke out against this report as the Court of Auditors, in its report on the annual accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking, issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying contracts for the fourth consecutive year.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I supported.ENIAC's budget for 2014 has been implemented and can be considered as approved.

name: Margot Parker (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ENIAC. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ENIAC (European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Council) is a research programme aimed at the integration and miniaturisation of devices and increasing their functionalities. ENIAC is set up as a private-public partnership, bringing together the EU Commission and the Member and Associated States. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 356 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 000. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing.- With regard to the proposal for a European Parliament decision on discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 I would like to say positively.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: written. - The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was established on 20 December 2007 for a period of 10 years to identify and implement a "research program" for the development of key knowledge in nanoelectronics in various fields of application. The founding members of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking are the European Union, represented by the Commission, Belgium, Germany, Estonia, Ireland, Greece, Spain, France, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Sweden and the United Kingdom, and the Association for European Nanoelectronics Activities (AENEAS). The maximum Union contribution to the Joint Undertaking for a period of 10 years shall be EUR 450 000 000 and shall be paid from the budget of the Seventh Research Framework Program. In its Report on the Annual Accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, the Court of Auditors stated that the annual accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking correctly reflect in all material respects the financial position of the Joint Undertaking at 31 December 2014 and the results of operations and cash flows. that completed year. Although the vote on the Discharge was postponed due to the lack of assurance on the proper implementation of projects in the Member States, the ENIAC Joint Undertaking has so far provided all requested information to support the statement that the implementation of national procedures provides reasonable assurance on the legality and regularity of transactions. I therefore support the approval of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking's discharge in respect of the financial year 2014.

name: Tonino Picula (S&D)
text: written. - Joint ventures bring industry and research bodies together in public-private partnerships with the aim of supporting research, the production of new technologies and accelerating their introduction to the market. It covers a wide range of sectors - from air traffic control, through computer technology to nuclear fusion, areas whose development contributes to the well-being of EU citizens. The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was established on 20 December 2007 for a period of 10 years to establish and implement a research program for the development of key competences in nanoelectronics in various fields of application, and was granted financial independence in July 2010. EINAC and ARTEMIS were later merged to create a joint technology initiative for electronic components and systems for Europe's leading position. ECSEL's financial statements for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 faithfully present in all material respects its financial position as at 26 June 2014 and its results of operations and cash flows for the period ended that day, in accordance with provisions of financial and accounting rules. I welcome the Joint Undertaking's guarantee that national procedures provide a reasonable guarantee as to the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions. Nowadays, no economy can succeed in the global market without mastering these technologies that have an incomparable strategic impact. In Europe, we need to build a dynamic ecosystem for the development of new technologies.

name: João Pimenta Lopes (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- ENIAC was created in December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of defining and executing a "research agenda" for the development of essential skills in the field of nanoelectronics across the different areas of application.ENIAC is a PPP.Despite ENIAC's accounts for the period from 1 January to 26 June 2014, they faithfully reflect, in all materially relevant aspects, and its financial situation on 26 June 2014, as well as the results of its operations and flowsof cash for the period ended on that date, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations and the accounting rules adopted by the EC accountant, we voted against the report as a political sign of our disagreement with the existence of this entity and its format.

name: Miroslav Poche (S&D)
text: in writing.- As shadow rapporteur for the discharge for ENIAC, I already recommended (unlike the rapporteur) the discharge in June.The budget discharge was postponed only for formal reasons.In the meantime, the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, which took over ARTEMIS and ENIAC in mid-2014, provided sufficient evidence that all accounting at the level of the National Agencies was transparent and with a minimum of error.I am glad that the second report on the budget discharge has thus received the smooth support of the European Parliament.

name: Salvatore Domenico Pogliese (PPE)
text: in writing.- This proposal for a decision grants discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (former ENIAC Joint Undertaking and ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget for the financial year 2014. I welcome the information and assurances provided byECSEL.Therefore, I voted in favor of granting discharge.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of granting the 2014 discharge to the ENIAC (nanoelectronics) Joint Undertaking.This technical vote follows the recommendations of the Budgetary Control Committee of the European Parliament.

name: Paulo Rangel (PPE)
text: in writing. - The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was formed on 20 December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the aim of defining and implementing a "research agenda" for the development of essential skills in the field of nanoelectronics. It started operating autonomously in 2010. ENIAC and the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking were merged to create the joint technological initiative in the field of "Electronic components and systems for European leadership". The merger took place in 2014 and the new initiative went into operation in June 2014, and its operation is scheduled for the next ten years. This report gives discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking and ENIAC Joint Undertaking) for the execution of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. As the required documentation confirms that the processing of procedures in the States Members provides reasonable assurance as to the legality and regularity of transactions, I voted for.

name: Julia Reid (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ENIAC. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ENIAC (European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Council) is a research programme aimed at the integration and miniaturisation of devices and increasing their functionalities. ENIAC is set up as a private-public partnership, bringing together the EU Commission and the Member and Associated States. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 356 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 000. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: Sofia Ribeiro (PPE)
