text: in writing.- I voted in favor, since the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January to 26 June 2014 faithfully reflect, in all material respects, its financial situation on 26 June 2014, as well asthe results of its operations and cash flows for the period ended on that date, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer.

name: Liliana Rodrigues (S&D)
text: in writing.- Approves the closure of the accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Inmaculada Rodríguez-Piñero Fernández (S&D)
text: written.- I voted for the discharge of the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the ENIAC Joint Undertaking and the Artemis Joint Undertaking) on the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, in view of thereport prepared by the Committee on Budgetary Control, which confirms that the accounts of the Joint Undertaking accurately present, in all their significant aspects, its financial situation.

name: Claude Rolin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I have decided to vote in favor of postponing the decision of the European Parliament concerning the discharge to the Director of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the implementation of the budget for the financial year 2014. I am concerned about this.effect of the fact that the Court of Auditors has formulated for the fourth consecutive year a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions.

name: Fernando Ruas (PPE)
text: in writing. - The ENIAC Company was created in December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of defining and executing a research agenda for the development of skills in the area of ​​nanoelectronics. According to the Court of Auditors' report on the company's annual accounts for the period from 01/01/14 to 06/26/14, a qualified opinion was issued, for the fourth consecutive year, with respect to regularity and legality of the underlying transactions, on the grounds that the administrative agreements signed with the national financing entities were not evaluated by the company taking into account the quality of the audit reports received from the national financing entities, on the costs related to the completed projects. Notwithstanding, the company invited national financing entities to provide evidence that the application of national procedures provides reasonable assurance as to the legality and regularity of operations, having had the desired effect. In view of the above and based on the understanding of the Committee on Budgetary Control in this matter, I voted in favor of this report, which gives discharge, for the implementation of the budget for the financial year 2014.

name: Lola Sánchez Caldentey (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In the spring, both technology companies, of private public financing, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Sven Schulze (PPE)
text: written.- I voted for the discharge of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking.The ENIAC Joint Undertaking has provided the Committee on Budgetary Control (CONT) with all the information requested to support the statement that the implementation of national procedures provides sufficient assurance that the transactions are legal and regular.

name: Maria Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of nanotechnological knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.This knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee private exploitation of it.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in nanotechnology, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ ENIAC Joint Undertaking (JU) was a public-private partnership in the field of nanotechnology. In 2014, it was replaced by the ECSEL JU following a merger with the Artemis JU. In April of this year, the plenary voted to postpone discharge for ENIAC, with the rapporteur citing that additional reassurances were needed from ECSEL, the successor JU, concerning the implementation of national procedures to ensure the legality and regularity of transactions. The S&D Group voted in favour of discharge in April. Since then, the JU has provided additional reassurances and the rapporteur proposes to grant discharge this time. Joint Undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Domains covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the JUs in their many areas of work, which is of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Monika Smolková (S&D)
text: in writing. - I supported the discharge for the financial year 2014 for the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking for the budgetary implementation of ENIAC. The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was set up in 2007 to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of key competences for nanoelectronics in various fields of application. In April this year, Parliament decided to postpone the discharge for the financial year 2014, as the ENIAC and ARTEMIS Joint Undertakings were merged that year, creating the Joint Technology Initiative Electronic Components and Systems for European Leadership (JTI ECSEL). At that time, the rapporteur expressed the belief that national procedures were needed to ensure the legality of individual transactions. In the meantime, as the Joint Undertaking had provided all the guarantees that Parliament had called for, we finally decided to grant discharge. Joint ventures are an important area for industry and research cooperation for the EU. These companies are based on a public-private partnership that supports research, new technologies and faster launch of specific technologies. The EU has long had good experience with the results of joint ventures, which is why I believe that ECSEL will be just as successful in its ten years of operation.

name: Ivan Štefanec (PPE)
text: in writing.- The management of European taxpayers' money is at the heart of the media, politicians and the public.In this respect, we cannot afford any unjustified mistakes that would cast a shadow of doubt on efficient management.ENIAC should therefore finally take note of and apply the Court's reservations raised for the fourth consecutive year.

name: Beatrix von Storch (EFDD)
text: written.- I did not agree to the resolution of the European Parliament on the "discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014".The EU should not operate in the form of joint undertakings.This creates non-transparent shadow households.The company itself is wrong in terms of economic policy.Even if you approve of research subsidies, research should not be done directly by the EU.The denial of discharge is mandatory.

name: Patricija Šulin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the second discharge report on the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The ENIAC Joint Undertaking, set up in 2007 to define and implement a research program to develop key competences for nanoelectronics in different fields, is among 1January 2014 and June 26, 2014, in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer.However, we may be concerned that, for the fourth year in a row, the Court of Auditors issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions.

name: Νεοκλής Συλικιώτης (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- We vote in favor of the discharge in terms of budget execution, as it covers additional costs incurred.

name: Ελευθέριος Συναδινός (NI)
text: in writing.- The reported financial data must be sufficient, accompanied by actions to correct previous remarks, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective operations.

name: Tibor Szanyi (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report giving discharge to the Executive Director of the European Nanoelectronics Initiative Advisory Board (ECSEL) Joint Undertaking in respect of the implementation of its budget for the financial year 2014 and approves the closure of the accounts of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.I also urge that, like the report, the remarks in the attached resolution on budget and financial management be taken into account.

name: Claudia Țapardel (S&D)
text: signed up.- The ENIAC Joint Undertaking was a public-private partnership in the field of nanotechnology, being replaced in 2014 by ECSEL JU, following a merger with Artemis JU.Following the plenary decision to postpone the discharge for ENIAC in April this year, the JU provided additional assurances regarding the implementation of national procedures to ensure the legality and regularity of operations.In this context, I support the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Marc Tarabella (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the discharge.I would like to take advantage of this explanation of vote to underline my disappointment at the fact that the European Council and the Council do not present their annual activity report to Parliament.This is unacceptable and it damages the reputation of the institutions of the European Union!

name: Pavel Telička (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ The ENIAC Joint Undertaking (JU), focused on nano-electronics, is a research programme aimed at enhancing the further integration and miniaturisation of devices and increasing their functionalities. The report on the 2014 budget discharge is a document that consolidates the annual accounts of the EU for the 2014 financial year on the basis of information provided by the various institutions, organisations and bodies of the EU. The document sets out how the JUs spent and implemented their budget in 2014. I voted in favour of the report on discharge in respect of the JUs 2014 budget, which also made a series of recommendations to improve future budgets and on the auditing of project costs, which will allow for improvements and more transparency in future budgets.

name: Ruža Tomašić (ECR)
text: written.- I voted against the decision on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. ENIAC was established on 20 December 2007 to establish and implement a research program to develop key competences in nanoelectronics in various fields of applicationand enabled the development of new markets and social applications.As for the other joint ventures, I believe that ENIAC cannot be discharged until the Court of Auditors issues a positive and transparent report for the entire 2014 budget.

name: Romana Tomc (PPE)
text: in writing. - I supported the proposal for a decision on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 shall, in all material respects, fairly represent its financial position at 26 June 2014 and its profit and loss and cash flows for the period then ended, in accordance with the provisions of its Financial Rules. and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer. In its report on the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January to 26 June 2014, the Court of Auditors issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions for the fourth year in a row, as the administrative agreements signed with the national funding bodies audits of cost claims for projects do not include a practical solution for ex-post audits. The Court of Auditors' report notes that the final budget of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2,356,000 and payment appropriations of EUR 76 500 250. Parliament shall give a discharge to the Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the ENIAC Joint Undertaking and the Artemis Joint Undertaking) in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Estefanía Torres Martínez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In the spring, both technology companies, of private public financing, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Kazimierz Michał Ujazdowski (ECR)
text: in writing.- The report concerns the discharge for the ENIAC Joint Undertaking.It should be recalled that in the spring the discharge was strongly opposed by the Court of Auditors, ie the institution responsible for auditing the Union's accounts.In the qualified opinion, the Tribunal then drew attention to a number of irregularities, includingthe information needed to calculate the error rate in the Member States' audits is missing.Despite sending additional documents by the national authorities, I have doubts whether the existing irregularities have been eliminated.At this stage of the procedure, Parliament has only two options: it can grant discharge (in line with the rapporteur's resolution) or refuse it.I voted against the resolution.

name: Miguel Urbán Crespo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In the spring, both technology companies, of private public financing, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Ivo Vajgl (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the second report on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The report acknowledges the fact that the joint undertaking’s accounts for the period 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 present fairly, in all material respects, its financial position on 26 June 2014 and the results of its operations and cash flows for the period then ended, in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission’s accounting officer. I voted in favour because I believe that the implementation of the national procedures provide a reasonable assurance on the legality and regularity of these transactions.

name: Ángela Vallina (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of nanotechnological knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.This knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee private exploitation of it.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in nanotechnology, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Hilde Vautmans (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report because the annual accounts for the period 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 give a true and fair view in all material respects of the financial situation as at 26 June 2014 and of the results of the transactions and cash flows for thosedate of the period closed, in accordance with the provisions of the financial regulation and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer.

name: Miguel Viegas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- ENIAC was created in December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of defining and executing a "research agenda" for the development of essential skills in the field of nanoelectronics across the different areas of application.ENIAC is a PPP.Despite ENIAC's accounts for the period from 1 January to 26 June 2014, they faithfully reflect, in all materially relevant aspects, and its financial situation on 26 June 2014, as well as the results of its operations and flowsof cash for the period ended on that date, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations and the accounting rules adopted by the EC accountant, we voted against the report as a political sign of our disagreement with the existence of this entity and its format.

name: Harald Vilimsky (ENF)
text: written.- The Court of Auditors issued only a limited opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions in its report on the annual accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.This is now the case for the fourth time in a row.This questionable fact is addressed in the present application, but no conclusions are drawn from it, even though the taxpayers provided the company with the sum of 3 billion euros.I therefore rejected the motion for a resolution.

name: Auke Zijlstra (ENF)
text: written.- The PVV voted against the discharge of the budget of the Eniac Joint Undertaking.The PVV takes the position that, no matter how agencies like Eniac use their budgets, the European Union does not add value to research budgets.Research can easily be financed by the sovereign member states themselves and researchers can easily determine when and how they enter into collaborations with other (foreign) research institutions.According to the PVV, there is therefore no reason whatsoever to support or finance EU agencies.

name: Milan Zver (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the European Parliament decision of 27 October 2016 on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, which gave discharge to the Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (former ENIAC Joint Undertaking and Artemis Joint Undertaking)ENIAC for the financial year 2014. The annual accounts of the ENIAC Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 shall, in all material respects, present fairly its financial position at 26 June 2014 and its profit and loss and cash flows for the period then ended,in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer.

name: Isabella Adinolfi (EFDD)
text: in writing.- The Court of Auditors has issued a qualified opinion on the regularity of Artemis's budget transactions.Furthermore, the audit studies carried out present three different methods of carrying out, not allowing an overall assessment and comparison and it was also found that the company did not comply with the internal control standards relating to financial regulations.Due to the lack of sufficient elements and while supporting the content of the report, I voted negative for the discharge.

name: Tim Aker (EFDD)
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ARTEMIS. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ARTEMIS is a public-private partnership between the Commission, Member States, and industry and research institutes. It was set up in December 2007 for a 10-year period to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 554 510 and payment appropriations of EUR 30 330 178. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: Marina Albiol Guzmán (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of computer knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.Said knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee its exclusive exploitation.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in computing, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Martina Anderson Lynn Boylan and Liadh Ní Riada (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was asked to provide further information to the Committee on Budgetary Control on the reliability of its accounts and the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions. The replies provided by the Executive Director of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking were considered to be satisfactory while reiterating some concerns stated in the report, in particular regarding internal control standards. I therefore voted in favour of the closure of the ARTEMIS accounts for 2014 and in favour of the resolution.

name: Νίκος Ανδρουλάκης (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the Second Report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, because I support the actions of such Joint Undertakings in various fields, which offer many benefits to the daily lives of European citizens.

name: Marie-Christine Arnautu (ENF)
text: in writing. - This report calls for discharge for the implementation of the budget. Although the Artemis and Eniac Joint Undertakings were merged to give birth in 2014 to the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, the report regrets that the annual assessment of the agency's accounts has not taken over the past management of these and that it was no longer successful. Indeed, many financial commitments continued in 2014, in connection with the joint venture, without it being possible to establish whether they concerned ECSEL or Artemis. From a management point of view, this poses a problem of regularity of the accounts. In addition, the Joint Undertaking has not changed its management rules to comply with the new financial regulation in place. Although now amalgamated, it is legally bound to comply with it, as long as it exists. Finally, no solid policy for preventing conflicts of interest has been put in place. The report nevertheless states that the Joint Undertaking has obtained audit reports from the national authorities attesting to its financial soundness since the last discharge. However, management is not yet rigorous enough, as the audits fail to cover all of the operations monitored. I voted against this report.

name: Jonathan Arnott (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ This decision is to grant discharge and close the accounts of ARTEMIS. This is a public-private partnership between the Commission, Member States, industry and research institutes. It was set up in December 2007 for a period of 10 years to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of key technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 554 510 and payment appropriations of EUR 30 330 178.

name: Jean Arthuis (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report as recommended by the committee responsible in its second reading, taking into account the receipt of additional evidence to justify and close the accounts on the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the'fiscal year 2014.

name: Zigmantas Balčytis (S&D)
text: in writing.- 2007December.The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was set up for a period of ten years to develop and implement a research agenda for the development of key technologies for embedded computing systems in a wide range of applications, in order to foster the Union's competitiveness and sustainability and enable new markets and societal applications.The Joint Undertaking's financial statements for 2014 are presented in all material respects in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules approved by the Commission's Accounting Officer.However, I agree with the Court of Auditors, which states in its report that the Joint Undertaking did not assess the quality of the audit reports on the costs of completed projects received from the National Funding Institutions (NFIs).

name: Gerard Batten (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ARTEMIS. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation.  ARTEMIS is a public—private partnership between the Commission, Member States, industry and research institutes. It was set up in December 2007 for a 10—year period to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 554 510 and payment appropriations of EUR 30 330 178. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: Nicolas Bay (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this report which calls for a discharge for the implementation of the budget of the Artemis Joint Undertaking.As the latter has been merged into another within the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, the management of the accounts is murky, as it is not possible to establish the regularity of the financial commitments which date from before the merger and are continuing.Other problems should be noted, for example the lack of a policy preventing conflicts of interest or the lack of updating of management rules to comply with the new financial regulations in force.

name: Hugues Bayet (S&D)
text: in writing.- In accordance with the proposal of the Committee on Budgetary Control I voted in favor of the discharge for Artemis for the financial year 2014.

name: Brando Benifei (S&D)
text: in writing.- The budget discharge procedure represents an important moment in the institutional life of the European Union.On this occasion the European Parliament, the only institution elected by universal suffrage by the citizens, decides on the recommendation of the Council whether or not to guarantee the final approval of the implementation of the budget for a given financial year.This is a fundamental step which is also an opportunity to address specific recommendations to the institutions and agencies that make up the structure of the Union.Following the guidance of the Committee on Budgetary Control (CONT), today I decided to vote in favor of the Marinescu report granting discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (former ENIAC Joint Undertaking and ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking) for implementationof the Joint Undertaking's budget for the financial year 2014.

name: Xabier Benito Ziluaga (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In the spring, both technology companies, of private public financing, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Izaskun Bilbao Barandica (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report on the 2014 discharge of Artemis.The accounts faithfully present the results in their significant aspects, for which I have supported the approval of their management.

name: Dominique Bilde (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this report which asked to grant discharge for the implementation of the Artemis budget for the financial year 2014. Of course, Artemis merged with Eniac in 2014 in the joint venture called ECSEL.However, the problems mainly come from this merger, as the report rightly notes: financial commitments continued in 2014 without it being known whether they relate to Ecsel, i.e. the new joint venture., or Artemis.This kind of opacity obviously calls into question the regularity of the accounts.An irregularity which is also found in the lack of alignment of Ecsel with the new financial regulation.Finally, and this seems appropriate with many EU agencies and joint undertakings, for ECSEL there is a total lack of transparency as regards the prevention of conflicts of interest.

name: Mara Bizzotto (ENF)
text: in writing.- I believe that the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking does not yet provide adequate guarantees of transparency, and I therefore did not intend to support this report with my vote and grant discharge.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: written.- I voted for the discharge of the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the Artemis Joint Undertaking and the ENIAC Joint Undertaking) on the implementation of the budget of the Artemis Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, in view of thereport prepared by the Committee on Budgetary Control, which confirms that the accounts of the Joint Undertaking accurately present, in all their significant aspects, its financial situation.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report, which deals with the 2014 work of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking. discharge. 2007 December. the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking (hereinafter referred to as "the Joint Undertaking") has been set up for a period of ten years to develop and implement a research agenda for the development of key technologies for embedded computing systems in various fields, to promote the Union's competitiveness and sustainability and enable new markets; for the benefit of society. This Joint Undertaking became operational in 2009. October month. The European Parliament notes that the Joint Undertaking's financial statements for 2014 January 1 - 2014 June 26 its financial position in 2014 June 26 and the results and cash flows of transactions relating to the period ended on that date are presented in all material respects in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules approved by the Commission's accounting officer. Parliament therefore approves the closure of the accounts of this Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Franc Bogovič (PPE)
text: in writing.- As in the previous vote, I supported the discharge to the Director in respect of the implementation of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking's budget for the financial year 2014, as the European Parliament noted that the Joint Undertaking's accounts for the period 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 were fair in all material respects.represents its financial position as at 26 June 2014 and its profit or loss and cash flows for the period then ended, in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and accounting rules.

name: Biljana Borzan (S&D)
text: written.- I support this 2014 Discharge Report for the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking.Joint Undertakings bring together industries and research bodies into public-private partnerships to support research, new technologies and demonstration activities and accelerate the market introduction of individual technologies.Domains include air traffic control, carbon energy, nanotechnology, computer technology, cleaner aviation technology, and nuclear fusion.I support JUS in its many areas of work that are beneficial to EU citizens.

name: Marie-Christine Boutonnet (ENF)
text: in writing.- This report recommends granting discharge for the implementation of the budget of this Joint Undertaking, while at the same time it raises serious doubts about the rigor of its management, in particular the fact that the audits do not cover theall of the operations monitored and that there is still some uncertainty between the activities of ARTEMIS and those of ECSEL following the merger in 2014 with ENIAC.I am therefore voting against this report.

name: Renata Briano (S&D)
text: in writing. - Parliament grants discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (former ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking and ENIAC Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 and approves its closure of the accounts for the financial year 2014. Parliament acknowledges that the Joint Undertaking's accounts for the period 1 January-26 June 2014 faithfully present the Joint Undertaking's financial position; but is concerned that the Court of Auditors has issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the transactions underlying the accounts, as the administrative arrangements concluded with the National Financing Authorities (NFAs) do not contain practical arrangements for carrying out ex post audits. Parliament invites the Joint Undertaking to produce evidence that the implementation of national procedures provides a reasonable assurance as to the legality and regularity of the transactions and notes that the Joint Undertaking has not taken any measures regarding certain control standards internal information and financial reporting, noting that this was however due to the merger between ENIAC and ARTEMIS and that in the meantime the ECSEL JTI has made significant progress.

name: Steeve Briois (ENF)
text: in writing.- The report calls for discharge for the implementation of the budget of the company ARTEMIS.Audits and other management reports do not cover all of the operations monitored and no serious conflict prevention policy has been implemented.For these two main reasons, I voted against the report granting budgetary discharge.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: signed up. - The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking has a key role to play, being set up in 2007 for a period of 10 years, with the main objective of developing and implementing a research program to develop key technologies for integrated information systems in different application sectors, with the aim is to strengthen the Union's competitiveness and sustainability and to facilitate the emergence of new markets and societal applications. Following the audits carried out, it was found that the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking has accounts which provide a true and fair view of the financial situation and results of its operations, as well as the cash flows for the financial year 2014, in accordance with its financial rules. I am in favor of the discharge report for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, as I consider that this undertaking has managed the funds available in an efficient and transparent manner, constantly pursuing the purpose for which it was established.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of this report because in the light of the report presented by the Court of Auditors on the annual budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking, covering the period 1 January - 26 June 2014, the reliability of the accounts and the legitimacy the related transactions attributable to the aforementioned company. The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was established in December 2007 for a ten-year term in order to define and implement a research agenda for the development of essential technologies for embedded information systems in various application sectors. The maximum Union contribution to the Joint Undertaking for the entire decade is 420,000,000 euros, from the budget of the Seventh Research Framework Program. The financial contributions of ARTEMIS Member States should, on the other hand, be at least 1.8 times the Union financial contribution, while the in-kind contributions provided by the research and development organizations participating in the projects for the duration of the Joint Undertaking should be equal to or greater than the contribution of public bodies.

name: Matt Carthy (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was asked to provide further information to the Committee on Budgetary Control on the reliability of its accounts and the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions. The replies provided by the Executive Director of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking were considered to be satisfactory while reiterating some concerns stated in the report, in particular regarding internal control standards. I therefore voted in favour of the closure of the ARTEMIS accounts for 2014 and in favour of the resolution.

name: James Carver (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ARTEMIS. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ARTEMIS is a public-private partnership between the Commission, Member States, and industry and research institutes. It was set up in December 2007 for a 10-year period to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 554 510 and payment appropriations of EUR 30 330 178. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: David Casa (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of granting the discharge to Artemis joint undertaking to implement a Joint Technology Initiative embedded computing systems as following the submission of the documents required by the National Funding Authorities (NFAs) it could be confirmed that the implementation of the national procedures provide a reasonable assurance on the legality and regularity of their transactions. This information was being disputed by the Court of Auditors prior to these additional clarifications.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing. - The Court of Auditors, in its report on the Joint Undertaking's annual accounts, had expressed a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the transactions underlying the accounts, as the administrative arrangements concluded with the national funding authorities for as regards the audit of cost claims for projects, they did not contain practical methods for carrying out ex post audits: it was therefore not possible to draw conclusions on the effective functioning of ex post audits due to the different methodologies used they did not allow the joint venture to calculate a weighted error rate or a residual error rate. Furthermore, the joint venture had not adopted any measures regarding some internal control standards relating to financial information and disclosure. These shortcomings led to the failure to grant discharge in the first instance: as in fact the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking and the ENIAC Joint Undertaking were merged in 2014 to create the Joint Technology Initiative "Electronic Components and Systems for European Leadership" (ITC ECSEL), these shortcomings cannot in any way be resolved (in fact ARTEMIS no longer exists). For this reason, while supporting the content of the resolution, together with the M5S delegation, we have voted against granting discharge.

name: Λευτέρης Χριστοφόρου (PPE)
text: in writing.- We support the report on the closure of the accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of granting discharge for the 2014 budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking, and by this vote I intend to reiterate my openness to JTIs, i.e. modern mechanisms for the execution of research programs in within the Seventh Framework Program of the European Union. These are examples of long-term public-private partnerships implemented as joint ventures on the basis of Article 171 of the EC Treaty, which states that "the Community may create joint ventures or any other structure necessary for the better execution of research programs and technological development ". I therefore approve the closure of the ARTEMIS accounts despite the qualified opinion presented in the Court of Auditors' report on the legality and regularity of the transactions, to which must be added the qualitative insufficiency of the audit reports received from the national funding authorities (NFAs) and concerning costs related to completed projects. Combined with this, I am saddened by the absence of internal control standards for information and financial reporting regarding the valuation of assets, a sound internal control system and a clear internal audit structure itself. In any case, it is an ambitious project aimed at defining a common strategic research agenda capable of attracting investments.

name: Deirdre Clune (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the second report on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 and noted no objections.

name: Carlos Coelho (PPE)
text: in writing. - The discharge referred to in this report covers the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014, the date on which the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was merged with the ENIAC Joint Undertaking, giving rise to ITC ECSEL, a joint technological initiative in the field of 'Electronic components and systems for European leadership'. I am concerned that it was possible, according to the report of the Court of Auditors, to enter into administrative agreements with national funding bodies that did not include provisions on ex post audits. This fact is relevant because the different auditing practices did not allow ARTEMIS to calculate a weighted error rate, nor a residual error rate, which is significantly important to assess the costs related to completed projects. These doubts about the conformity of the transactions led to the postponement of the discharge. I welcome the fact that the process of merging the old companies and creating ITC ECSEL has made it possible to ascertain the legality and regularity of the operations, by sending relevant information by the national financing entities. This allows for a considered decision. I am pleased with the establishment of internal control standards and an internal audit structure by ITC ECSEL. For these reasons, I support this report.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 and following the opinions of the Court of Auditors on the reliability of the 2014 accounts and on the legality and regularity of the transactions which certified thecorrectness of expenses incurred and recorded by ARTEMIS.

name: Javier Couso Permuy (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of developing knowledge in computing and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.Said knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee its exclusive exploitation.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in computing, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Andrea Cozzolino (S&D)
text: in writing.- The ARTEMIS discharge presents lights and shadows which it is important to underline.On the one hand, Parliament was concerned that the Joint Undertaking did not adopt measures concerning certain rules on financial information and reporting, the evaluation of activities and internal control and audit systems.On the other hand, part of these problems were addressed by the ECSEL JTI, which arises from the merger of ENIAC and ARTEMIS, which has made progress on internal control systems and the establishment of an internal audit structure.Instead, it is emphasized that the data concerning the effectiveness of the guarantee systems are good as regards the ex post audit strategy.Therefore, I am voting in favor of this text, considering the progress on national procedures as positive but expressing the same concerns as the discharge with regard to internal control.

name: Edward Czesak (ECR)
text: in writing.- I voted against the 2014 discharge report, namely the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking, with the consequence that I did not grant discharge.I do not see any progress in the implementation of the project like ARTEMIS.I am not convinced by the arguments that the failure to grant discharge in spring 2016 was only due to a lack of information necessary to calculate the error rate for Member States' audits and a different error calculation system.For this reason, I voted against the discharge report.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of this discharge as the Joint Undertaking’s accounts for the period 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 were presented fairly, in all material respects, and the results of its operations and cash flows are in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission’s accounting officer. ARTEMIS was set up in 2007 for a period of 10 years to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of key technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas to strengthen European Union competitiveness and sustainability.

name: Daniel Dalton (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to postpone discharge again on this report because the European Court of Auditors did not give the EU budget as a whole a positive statement of assurance. The level of error for the year 2014 was estimated to be 4.4%, which, whilst a slight improvement on 2013, is still too high. It is the job of Parliament to verify that the EU budget was spent in accordance with the rules and in line with the principles of sound financial management, and unfortunately the Court of Auditors found that was not the case for the year 2014. We need more simplification of key areas of financial management in the EU budget and a stronger focus on tackling parts of the budget with a higher risk of problems.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (ENF)
text: in writing. - Although the Artemis and Eniac Joint Undertakings were merged to give birth in 2014 to the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, this report regrets that the annual assessment of the agency's accounts did not take over their past management. and was not more successful. Indeed, many financial commitments continued in 2014 without it being possible to establish whether they concerned ECSEL or Artemis. In terms of management, this poses a problem of regularity of the accounts. In addition, the Joint Undertaking has not changed its management rules to comply with the new financial regulation in place. Although now amalgamated, it is legally bound to comply with it, as long as it exists. Finally, no solid policy for the prevention of conflicts of interest has been implemented. The report nevertheless states that the Joint Undertaking has obtained audit reports from the national authorities attesting to its financial soundness since the last discharge. However, management is not yet rigorous enough, as the audits fail to cover all of the operations monitored. Also, I voted against.

name: Γεώργιος Επιτήδειος (NI)
text: in writing.- The reported financial data must be sufficient, accompanied by actions to correct previous remarks, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective operations.

name: Jill Evans (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this discharge report. The postponement of the discharge from April has enabled action to be taken to clarify some of the issues of concern to myself and my constituents in Wales.

name: José Manuel Fernandes (PPE)
text: in writing. - The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was created in December 2007 for a period of 10 years with the aim of defining and implementing a "research program" for the development of essential technologies in the field of computer systems incorporated in different application areas, in order to to strengthen the Union's competitiveness and sustainability and allow the emergence of new markets and social applications. According to the Court's report, the Joint Undertaking's final budget for the financial year 2014 included EUR 2 554 510 in commitment appropriations and EUR 30 330 178 in payment appropriations (operational) covering 89.5% of total grants Joint Undertaking granted. However, the Court of Auditors has published a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions, on the grounds that the administrative agreements concluded with the national funding entities, with regard to the audit of payment requests for projects, they do not include practical provisions for ex post audits.

name: Edouard Ferrand (ENF)
text: in writing.- Vote against: management not rigorous enough, audits not managing to cover all of the operations monitored.

name: João Ferreira (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - ARTEMIS was created in December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of establishing and executing a “research program” for the development of essential technologies in the field of computer systems incorporated in different application areas. ARTEMIS is a public-private partnership. When voting on the report on the constitution of this company, we expressed doubts and reservations about its creation, operation and management, immediately related to the use of public capital in the service of private interests. It should be noted that the Court of Auditors, in its report on the annual accounts of ARTEMIS for the financial year 2014, published a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions, on the grounds that the administrative agreements concluded with the National donors, as regards the audit of payment claims for projects, do not include practical provisions for ex post audits. According to the Court of Auditors, ARTEMIS has not taken any measures in relation to some of the internal control rules related to financial reporting and reporting. ARTEMIS did not assess the quality of the audit reports sent by the national funding agencies on the costs related to the completed projects.

name: Lorenzo Fontana (ENF)
text: in writing.- I am voting against the resolution, which is not strong enough.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (NI)
text: in writing. - I am voting against the second report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. ECSEL JTI called on the National Financing Authorities (ECAs) to provide evidence that the implementation of the national procedures provides reasonable assurance as to the legality and regularity of the transactions. By the deadline of 30 June 2016, 76% of the EAX summoned, representing 96.79% of the joint costs of ARTEMIS and the Joint Undertaking, had submitted the required documents and confirmed that the implementation of the national procedures provided reasonable assurance. on the legality and regularity of the transactions. However, it is not possible to control in depth the full range of specific costs. The reported financial data must be sufficient, accompanied by actions to correct previous observations, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective operations.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. I support the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Arne Gericke (ECR)
text: written.- I voted against the discharge of the ARTEMIS joint undertaking, because I do not see that the EU is using taxpayers' funds to support structures whose tasks should and can easily be taken over by industry itself.

name: Jens Gieseke (PPE)
text: written.- In order to keep Europe as a science location at a high level in the future, projects such as the Joint Technology Initiative (JTI) ARTEMIS (Advanced Research and Technology for Embedded Intelligence and Systems) need to be further promoted.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In the spring, both technology companies, of private public financing, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Theresa Griffin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Antanas Guoga (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. The European Parliament granted a discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Τάκης Χατζηγεωργίου (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- We supported the discharge in terms of budget execution, as it covers additional costs incurred.

name: Marian Harkin (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report, which granted the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking discharge in respect of the implementation of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking’s budget for the financial year 2014. This allowed Parliament to close the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for 2014. In addition, I was happy to support a number of comments included in the report, such as the concern raised by the Court of Auditors in its report on the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. In the report, the CoA issued a qualified opinion regarding the regularity and legality of the underlying transactions on the grounds that the administrative agreements signed with the national funding authorities regarding the audit of project cost claims do not include practical arrangements for ex-post audits. It was also a concern that the Joint Undertaking took no action regarding some internal control standards relating to information and financial reporting and that this was due to the impending merger. In the meantime, ECSEL JTI achieved substantial progress with regard to the implementation of the ICS and establishing internal audit capability.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the second discharge report for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, because its financial situation and cash flows are faithfully presented.Although certain internal control standards regarding information and financial reporting have not been fully complied with, no irregularities have been identified that would prevent discharge.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)
text: in writing.- While the incomplete audits carried out by the national authorities have demonstrated the good financial health of the Joint Undertaking, the management is not, in my opinion, considered sufficiently serious to the point of supporting the report's proposal to grant thedischarge for the implementation of the budget.I voted against.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the discharge for the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking.This vote has been refused many times, but the new information provided by ARTEMIS now allows us to grant this discharge.The discharge was granted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: written.- The Court of Auditors issued a qualified opinion in its report on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions of the Artemis Joint Undertaking.This primarily concerns the assessment of the activities, the assessment of the internal control systems and the internal audit office.That is why I would have voted against the discharge report.

name: Afzal Khan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint Undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities, and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Domains covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the JUs in their many areas of work, which is of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Gilles Lebreton (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this text because it is not critical enough: no proactive policy to prevent conflicts of interest has been implemented.

name: Marine Le Pen (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against the 2014 discharge report for the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking.Although the Artemis and Eniac Joint Undertakings were merged to give birth in 2014 to the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, the report regrets that the annual assessment of the agency's accounts did not take over their past management.Indeed, many financial commitments continued in 2014, without it being possible to establish whether they concerned ECSEL or Artemis.In terms of management, this poses a problem of regularity of the accounts.In addition, the Joint Undertaking has not changed its management rules to comply with the new financial regulation in place.Although now amalgamated, it is legally bound to comply with it, as long as it exists.Finally, no solid policy for preventing conflicts of interest has been put in place.

name: Philippe Loiseau (ENF)
text: in writing.- Although the Artemis and Eniac Joint Undertakings were merged to give birth in 2014 to the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, the report regrets that the annual assessment of the agency's accounts has not taken over the past management of these.Indeed, many financial commitments continued in 2014, without it being possible to establish whether they concerned ECSEL or Artemis.In terms of management, this situation poses a real problem of regularity of the accounts.In addition, the joint venture has not changed its management rules to comply with the new financial regulations in place.Finally, no solid policy for preventing conflicts of interest has been put in place.The management does not appear to us to be rigorous enough, the audits not being able to cover all of the operations monitored.As the report called for discharge for the implementation of this budget, I voted against.

name: Javi López (S&D)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the discharge of the Artemis Joint Undertaking because, although the approval was not given in April because the annual report of the Court of Auditors had indicated that the information necessary to calculate the rate oferrors after audits carried out by Member States, as their calculation methods had changed.Additional documents sent this time by the national authorities have shown that the calculations were correct

name: Paloma López Bermejo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of computer knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.Said knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee its exclusive exploitation.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in computing, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: in writing.- I voted against the discharge, that is, against the approval of the final report of the EU Artemis institution.Artemis is a joint computer research institute of the Commission, Member States and computer companies.I do not agree that the Member States and the Commission should have a stake in this company.In my opinion, research into computer technologies (creation of applications and programs) should be a matter for private companies.

name: Monica Macovei (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome the fact that the assurance systems of the ARTEMIS Member States are much more effective than the sufficient threshold. I am confident ARTEMIS will adopt measures related to the internal control standards on financial information. However, the merger company established an appropriate audit and internal control structure.

name: Ivana Maletić (PPE)
text: written.- The European Parliament gives discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking in respect of the implementation of the budget and closure of the accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The European Parliament's motion for a resolutionshow his financial condition.I therefore voted in favor of this report.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (ECR)
text: in writing.- I am voting against the second report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, as it is incomplete and well-founded, as well as the reasons given in detail in my speech to the European Parliament in Strasbourg onOctober 26, 2016.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this text.The annual assessment of the agency's accounts for the Joint Technology Initiative for the Development of Computer Technologies (ARTEMIS), merged since 2014 with the Agency on the Joint Technology Initiative for Nanoelectronics Technologies (ENIAC), nis not serious, and does not comply with the new financial regulations in place.Once again, the audits of the national authorities concerned validate the regularity of the accounts: one can again doubt the reliability of these reports.It is therefore inconceivable to validate the management of this enterprise.

name: Valentinas Mazuronis (ALDE)
text: in writing. - I supported the EP report on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of ARTEMIS for the financial year 2014. This company was established in 2007. December. for a period of ten years. Its purpose is to develop and implement a research agenda for the development of key technologies for embedded computing systems in a wide range of applications, thus contributing to the Union's competitiveness, the opening up of new markets and the development of societal technologies. For a period of ten years, the maximum amount of the Union contribution to the budget of the Joint Undertaking shall be EUR 420 000 000, to be paid from the budget of the Seventh Research Framework Program. In the light of the audit reports and the opinion of the Committee on Budgetary Control, Parliament notes that the company's financial position for the reporting period, results of related operations and cash flows are presented in all material respects in accordance with the company's financial rules and the Commission's accounting officer. The EP therefore approves the closure of the accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- This report gives discharge for the execution of the 2014 budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking created by the European Union to develop on-board computer systems and now merged into the ESELC Joint Undertaking on Electronic Components and Systems.The report notes, however, that the Court of Auditors has expressed reservations about the regularity and legality of the financial operations of this joint venture.She noted that state audit reports on the work of this body had not been assessed or taken into account.The report even expresses its "concern" over the lack of internal audit measures for the activity of this company.We therefore wonder why he gives discharge.I am therefore voting against this discharge report.

name: Nuno Melo (PPE)
text: in writing.- All European institutions that depend on the budget of the European Union must be strictly supervised by the Court of Auditors and by all entities with this function.It is necessary to assess whether Community funds are being used well, whether these institutions are complying with the objectives set and whether there is no waste of resources.In general, with few exceptions, to be assessed by the inspections that are known, we can say that the institutions concerned are using the funds made available correctly and complying with the proposed objectives.I therefore vote in favor of the discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking and ENIAC Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Roberta Metsola (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: in writing. - The Artemis Joint Undertaking, established in December 2007 for a period of 10 years, was tasked with establishing and implementing a research program for the development of essential technologies for on-board computer systems in various fields of application in order to strengthen the competitiveness of the European Union and sustainable development as well as to allow the emergence of new markets and new societal applications. To date, however, Artemis activities have been taken over under the ECSCEL Joint Undertaking. However, Artemis’s accounts were regularly audited for the period up to its integration into ECSEL. I voted in favor of granting discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking for the implementation of the budget of the Artemis Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. I also called for the closure of the accounts of the Artemis Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report because joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. I support the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: in writing.- The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was wound up in June by a Council Regulation of 6 May 2014, merging into the ECSEL Joint Undertaking and the ENIAC Joint Undertaking.On 28 April this year, Parliament decided to postpone the discharge decision due to problems with this.In its second report, the Committee on Budgetary Control now proposes that Parliament approve the closure of the accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.I voted accordingly.

name: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar (PPE)
text: in writing.- For the reasons set out in this report, it deserves my favorable vote, in the sense of giving discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking and ENIAC Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014I argue that the observations / suggestions presented should be taken into account in the future.

name: Claude Moraes (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this text.The granting of discharge, initially scheduled for the plenary session in April, had been postponed because Artemis had not provided certain information necessary for this grant.This information has since been correctly communicated to the CONT Commission.Therefore, there is no longer any objection to our granting both discharges.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Each year the European Parliament takes a decision, following a recommendation from the Council, regarding the discharge for budget implementation, through which its releases the Commission from its responsibility for managing the given budget for a specific year by marking the end of its execution. I voted for the 2014 discharge for the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking, an association for Embedded Systems operators in Europe, representing the research community including industry, universities and research institutes.

name: Franz Obermayr (ENF)
text: written.- In the report, the Court of Auditors issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying operations of the Joint Undertaking.This primarily concerns the assessment of the activities, the assessment of the internal control systems and the internal audit office.Because of the above fact, I spoke out against this report.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I supported.The ARTEMIS 2014 budget has been implemented and can be considered as approved.

name: Margot Parker (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ARTEMIS. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ARTEMIS is a public-private partnership between the Commission, Member States, and industry and research institutes. It was set up in December 2007 for a 10-year period to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 554 510 and payment appropriations of EUR 30 330 178. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing.- Given the final annual accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, I would like to comment positively in relation to the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: written. - The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking shall be financed by contributions from the Union and Member States at a rate of 1 to 1.8. The amount of appropriations in the Union budget for 2014 was EUR 198 000 000, which represents 48% of the total budget. However, I find with concern that, according to the Court of Auditors' report, budgetary constraints in the Member States have made it difficult to reserve the remaining part of the budget, which accounts for 52% of the total budget, and I believe that this practice must change. In its report on the annual accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, the Court of Auditors shall state that it has obtained reasonable assurance that the annual accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 are reliable and that the underlying transactions are legal and regular. Although the discharge vote was postponed because the Court of Auditors did not assess the quality of the audit reports received from national authorities related to the financing of the costs of completed projects, from the delay until now, the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking has provided all requested information belief in the legality and regularity of transactions. I therefore support the approval of the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Tonino Picula (S&D)
text: written. - The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was set up in December 2007 for a period of 10 years to identify and implement research programs to develop key technologies for embedded computing systems in order to increase the Union's competitiveness and sustainability and enable the emergence of new markets and socially relevant applications. ARTEMIS and ENIAC have joined forces to create a joint technology initiative for electronic components and systems for Europe's leading position. The ECSEL Joint Technology Initiative was created, which became operational in June 2014 for a period of 10 years. The financial statements of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 shall present in all material respects, in all material respects, its financial position as at 26 June 2014 and the results of operations and cash flows for the period then ended. financial and accounting rules. It should be noted that the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking has not taken any action related to certain internal control standards related to information and financial reporting. The reason for this is the merger that was on the horizon. In the meantime, however, the ECSEL Joint Technology Initiative has made significant progress in implementing internal control standards and establishing internal audit departments. ECSEL will strengthen the competitiveness of our electronics industries and all electronics-based industries.

name: João Pimenta Lopes (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- ARTEMIS was created in December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of establishing and executing a "research program" for the development of essential technologies in the field of computer systems incorporated in different application areas.Despite presenting, according to the report, the accounts accordingly, it should be noted that ARTEMIS is a public-private partnership.Hence our abstention.

name: Miroslav Poche (S&D)
text: in writing.- As shadow rapporteur for the budget discharge for ARTEMIS, I already recommended (unlike the rapporteur) the discharge in June.The budget discharge was postponed only for formal reasons.In the meantime, the ECSEL Joint Undertaking, which took over ARTEMIS and ENIAC in mid-2014, provided sufficient evidence that all accounting at the level of the National Agencies was transparent and with a minimum of error.I am glad that the second report on the budget discharge has thus received the smooth support of the European Parliament.

name: Salvatore Domenico Pogliese (PPE)
text: in writing.- Having regard to the declaration certifying the reliability of the accounts, as well as the legality and regularity of the related transactions submitted to the attention of the Court of Auditors for the financial year 2014, I vote in favor of the European Parliament to approve the proposal relating to the granting of discharge for theimplementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
