text: in writing.- I voted in favor of granting the 2014 discharge to the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking (on-board computer systems).This technical vote follows the recommendations of the Budgetary Control Committee of the European Parliament.

name: Paulo Rangel (PPE)
text: in writing. - The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was created in December 2007, with a duration of 10 years, with the aim of establishing and implementing a "research program" for the development of essential technologies in the field of computer systems incorporated in different application areas, in order to enhance the Union's competitiveness and sustainability and allow the emergence of new markets and social applications. ARTEMIS started operating autonomously in October 2009. Indeed, ARTEMIS and the ENIAC Joint Undertaking were merged to create a joint technological initiative in the field of "Electronic components and systems for European leadership". The merger took place in 2014 and the new initiative went into operation in June 2014, and its operation is scheduled for the next ten years. This report gives discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking and ENIAC Joint Undertaking) for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. As the required documentation confirms that the processing of procedures in Member States provides reasonable assurance as to the legality and regularity of transactions, I voted in favor.

name: Julia Reid (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ARTEMIS. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ARTEMIS is a public-private partnership between the Commission, Member States, and industry and research institutes. It was set up in December 2007 for a 10-year period to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 2 554 510 and payment appropriations of EUR 30 330 178. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: Sofia Ribeiro (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor, as I consider the objective of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking to be important, namely to establish and implement a research program for the development of essential technologies in the field of computer systems incorporated in different application areas, in order to strengthen competitiveness andthe sustainability of the Union and allow the emergence of new markets and social applications.And because the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January to 26 June 2014 reflect faithfully, in all material respects, its financial situation on 26 June 2014, as well as the results of its operations andcash flows for the period ended on that date, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer.

name: Liliana Rodrigues (S&D)
text: in writing.- Approves the closure of the accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Inmaculada Rodríguez-Piñero Fernández (S&D)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the discharge of the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly the Artemis Joint Undertaking and the ENIAC Joint Undertaking) on the implementation of the budget of the Artemis Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 in view of the reportprepared by the Budgetary Control Committee, which verifies that the accounts of the Joint Undertaking accurately present, in all their significant aspects, its financial situation.

name: Claude Rolin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I have decided to grant discharge to the Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking and discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking ITER for the implementation of the budget of thejoint undertaking for the financial year 2014. By voting on these two reports, I nevertheless support the recommendations made to these two companies and hope that they will be taken into account in the future.

name: Fernando Ruas (PPE)
text: in writing. - The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was created in December 2007, with the aim of establishing and implementing a “research program” for the development of essential technologies in the field of computer systems, in order to strengthen the Union's competitiveness and sustainability and to allow the emergence of new markets and social applications. After the merger between the Joint Undertaking and ENIAC, the Joint Technology Initiative was created in the field of “Electronic components and systems for European leadership” (ITC ECSEL) which went into operation in June 2014 and will operate for ten years. According to information made available, the accounts of this Joint Undertaking for the period from January to June 2014 reflect faithfully, its financial situation as well as the results of its operations and cash flows for that period, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations and the Commission's accounting rules. Although measures have not been taken in relation to some of the control standards with respect to financial information and communication, ITC ECSEL has made substantial progress with regard to the application of the internal control standards and audit structure, so I voted in favor of this discharge.

name: Sven Schulze (PPE)
text: written.- I voted to discharge the Artemis joint venture.The Artemis Joint Undertaking has provided the Committee on Budgetary Control (CONT) with all the information required to support the statement that the implementation of national procedures provides sufficient assurance that the transactions are legal and regular.

name: Maria Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of the development of computer knowledge and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.Said knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee its exclusive exploitation.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in computing, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Artemis Joint Undertaking (JU) was a public-private partnership in the field of embedded systems technology. In 2014, it was replaced by the ECSEL JU following a merger with the ENIAC JU. In April of this year, the plenary voted to postpone discharge for Artemis, with the rapporteur citing that additional reassurances were needed from ECSEL, the successor JU, concerning the implementation of national procedures to ensure the legality and regularity of transactions. The S&D Group voted in favour of discharge in April. Since then, the JU has provided additional reassurances and the rapporteur proposes to grant discharge this time. Joint Undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities, and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies. Domains covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the JUs in their many areas of work, which is of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Monika Smolková (S&D)
text: in writing. - I supported the discharge for the financial year 2014 for the Executive Director of ECSEL for the implementation of the budget of ARTEMIS. The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was set up in 2007 with the task of defining and implementing a research agenda for the development of key technologies in the field of embedded computing systems in various fields, thus enabling the emergence of new markets and societal applications. In April this year, Parliament decided to postpone the discharge for the financial year 2014, as the ENIAC and ARTEMIS Joint Undertakings were merged that year, creating the Joint Technology Initiative Electronic Components and Systems for European Leadership (JTI ECSEL). The rapporteur then expressed the conviction that national procedures needed to be implemented to ensure the legality of individual transactions. In the meantime, as the Joint Undertaking had provided all the guarantees that Parliament had called for, we finally decided to grant discharge. Joint ventures are an important area for industry and research cooperation for the EU. These companies are based on a public-private partnership that supports research, new technologies and faster launch of specific technologies. The EU has long had good experience with the results of joint ventures, which is why I believe that ECSEL will be just as successful in its ten years of operation.

name: Ivan Štefanec (PPE)
text: in writing.- European Union businesses are used to coordinate and implement projects of common interest, and their centralized management is more efficient than would be the case for the individual action of individual Member States.For this reason, the methodology for assessing the spending of funds should also be unified, as different approaches make it difficult or even impossible for a comprehensive and realistic audit.

name: Beatrix von Storch (EFDD)
text: written.- I did not agree to the resolution of the European Parliament on the "discharge for the implementation of the budget of the Artemis Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014".The EU should not operate in the form of joint undertakings.This creates non-transparent shadow households.The company itself is wrong in terms of economic policy.Even if you approve of research subsidies, research should not be done directly by the EU.The denial of discharge is mandatory.

name: Patricija Šulin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the second discharge report on the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking, set up to implement and implement a research program to develop key technologies for embedded computing systems in different fields, is among 1On 1 January 2014 and 26 June 2014, it operated in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer.However, on the basis of a report from the Court of Auditors, the Joint Undertaking did not assess the quality of the audit reports of the national funding bodies related to the costs of completed projects.

name: Νεοκλής Συλικιώτης (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- We vote in favor of the discharge in terms of budget execution, as it covers additional costs incurred.

name: Ελευθέριος Συναδινός (NI)
text: in writing.- The reported data must be sufficient, accompanied by actions to correct previous remarks, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective operations.

name: Tibor Szanyi (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the report on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, which grants discharge to the Executive Director of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking in respect of the implementation of its budget for the financial year 2014. closing of its accounts. It is to be welcomed that the Court considers that the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 comply in all material respects with the provisions of its Financial Regulation and the rules adopted by the Commission's Accounting Officer. i financial situation. I also share the report's concern that the Joint Undertaking has not taken action on internal control standards for information and financial reporting.

name: Claudia Țapardel (S&D)
text: signed up.- The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was a public-private partnership in the field of integrated systems technology, replacing ECSEL JU in 2014. Considering that in April 2016 the plenary voted to postpone the discharge for Artemis, the company made efforts toprovide additional assurance on the effectiveness of the implementation of national procedures.In this situation, I again express my support for the discharge.I believe that the Joint Undertakings bringing together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships make a substantial contribution to supporting research, new technologies and demonstration activities, accelerating the placing of specific technologies on the market.

name: Marc Tarabella (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the discharge.I would like to take advantage of this explanation of vote to underline my disappointment at the fact that the European Council and the Council do not present their annual activity report to Parliament.This is unacceptable and it damages the reputation of the institutions of the European Union!

name: Pavel Telička (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking (JU), focused on technological developments, is a research programme aimed at contributing to the development of a strong and globally competitive electronics industry in the EU. The report on the 2014 discharge is a document that consolidates the annual accounts of the EU for the 2014 financial year on the basis of information provided by the various institutions, organisations and bodies of the EU. The document sets out how the JUs spent and implemented their budget in 2014. I voted in favour of the report, to grant discharge in respect of the JUs’ 2014 budget, which also made a series of recommendations on improving future budgets and auditing project costs, making for improvements and more transparency in future budgets.

name: Ruža Tomašić (ECR)
text: written. - I believe that the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking should not be given a discharge for 2014, because the Court of Auditors did not give a discharge in full to the budgets of the European Union for that year. ARTEMIS is a joint venture that aims to identify and implement a “research program” to develop key technologies for embedded computing systems in different applications in order to increase European competitiveness and sustainability and enable the emergence of new markets and societal applications. The Court of Auditors' report shows that the company did not assess the quality of the audit reports received from the national funding bodies regarding the costs associated with the completed projects, as the methodologies used by the national funding bodies were different and a reliable weighted error rate could not be calculated. or the remaining error rate. As it is evident that the company has not taken measures related to some internal control standards related to information and financial reporting, I voted against the discharge for ARTEMIS for 2014.

name: Romana Tomc (PPE)
text: in writing. - I supported the proposal for a decision on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking was set up in December 2007 for a period of 10 years to set up and implement a research program to develop key technologies for embedded computing systems in various fields of application, to improve European competitiveness and sustainability and to create new markets and social applications. The annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 shall, in all material respects, fairly present its financial position at 26 June 2014 and its profit and loss and cash flows for the period then ended in accordance with its financial rules. and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer. In its report on the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, the Court of Auditors issued a qualified opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions, as the administrative agreements signed with national funding bodies concerning audits of project reimbursement claims do not include a practical solution. for subsequent audits. Parliament shall give a discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. Parliament shall approve the annual accounts of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Estefanía Torres Martínez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- In relation to the ITER report, the CONT report assesses the efficiency, transparency and regularity of the ITER accounts.This is the second report, because the decision was postponed in spring.I am voting against, because despite the fact that some papers have been put into order, ITER continues to be an inefficient waste of resources for a dubious, centralizing project with high opportunity costs.Therefore I vote against the approval of the discharge.

name: Kazimierz Michał Ujazdowski (ECR)
text: in writing.- The report concerns the discharge for the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking.It should be recalled that in spring the discharge was strongly opposed by the Court of Auditors, the institution responsible for auditing the Union's accounts.In the qualified opinion, the Tribunal then drew attention to a number of irregularities, includingthe information needed to calculate the error rate in the Member States' audits is missing.Despite sending additional documents by the national authorities, I have doubts whether the existing irregularities have been eliminated.At this stage of the procedure, Parliament has only two options: it can grant discharge (in line with the rapporteur's resolution) or not.So I voted against the resolution.

name: Miguel Urbán Crespo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I accept the approval of the accounts and the download.In the spring, both technology companies, of private public financing, did not show enough reports to clarify their financial situation.They had merged into ECSEL, and after this impasse of lack of information due to the imminence of the merger, the contributions of reports have been corrected.That does not mean that all aspects are perfect, but Parliament's assessment is limited to reasons of good resource management and transparency, which, in this case, seems to be fulfilled.

name: Ivo Vajgl (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the second report on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking (‘the Joint Undertaking’) was set up in December 2007 for a period of 10 years to establish and implement a research agenda for the development of key technologies for embedded computing systems across different application areas in order to strengthen Union competitiveness and sustainability and to allow for the emergence of new markets and societal applications. The maximum contribution for the period of 10 years from the Union to the Joint Undertaking is EUR 420 000 000, to be paid from the budget of the Seventh Research Framework Programme. I voted in favour because I believe that the Joint Undertaking’s accounts for the period 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 present fairly, in all material respects, its financial position on 26 June 2014 and the results of its operations and cash flows for the period then ended, in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission’s accounting officer.

name: Ángela Vallina (GUE/NGL)
text: written.‒I have not been able to vote in favor of this report, because despite sharing the importance of developing knowledge in computing and approving the management of the consortium, I believe that there are other ways to maximize its development.Public research has proven to be the main innovator in Europe, with the private sector benefiting from spending in this sector.I believe that the development of knowledge and technology in the public sector should not be privatized by private companies.Said knowledge should benefit all European economic actors and not guarantee its exclusive exploitation.That is why, despite sharing the need for investment in computing, I have not been able to vote in favor of this management report.

name: Miguel Viegas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- ARTEMIS was created in December 2007, for a period of 10 years, with the objective of establishing and executing a "research program" for the development of essential technologies in the field of computer systems incorporated in different application areas.Despite presenting, according to the report, the accounts accordingly, it should be noted that ARTEMIS is a public-private partnership.Hence our abstention.

name: Harald Vilimsky (ENF)
text: written.- In its report on the annual accounts of the Artemis Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, the Court of Auditors issued only a limited opinion on the legality and regularity of the underlying transactions.This questionable fact is addressed in the present application, but no consequences are drawn from it, even though the taxpayers provided the company with the sum of 2.5 billion euros.I therefore rejected the motion for a resolution.

name: Auke Zijlstra (ENF)
text: written.- The PVV voted against the discharge of the budget of the Artemis Joint Undertaking.The PVV is of the opinion that, no matter how agencies like Artemis use their budget, the European Union does not add value to research budgets.Research can easily be financed by the sovereign member states themselves and researchers can easily determine when and how they enter into collaborations with other (foreign) research institutions.According to the PVV, there is therefore no reason whatsoever to support or finance EU agencies.

name: Milan Zver (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the Decision of the European Parliament of 27 October 2016 on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. Discharge to the Executive Director of the ECSEL Joint Undertaking (formerly ENIAC and ARTEMIS Joint Undertakings)I supported 2014.It is noted that the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the period from 1 January 2014 to 26 June 2014 present, in all material respects, its financial position at 26 June 2014 and its profit and loss and cash flows for the period then ended in accordance withthe provisions of its financial rules and the accounting rules adopted by the Commission's accounting officer.

name: Isabella Adinolfi (EFDD)
text: in writing.- The audit activity carried out within the company highlighted major risk factors, and the need for more robust controls with regard to management control and changes was highlighted.The Court of Auditors had also stressed the riskiness of the system, especially as regards the procurement procedures.To remedy the above problems, the new administration has increased the cost estimate, creating a high concern because any delay would cause significant increases in time and costs.Due to the lack of sufficient elements, I voted negative for the discharge.

name: Tim Aker (EFDD)
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ITER. Discharge is a procedure whereby the EU parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on its implementation. ITER was set up in March 2007 for a period of 35 years and involves the Commission, Member States and third countries. The aim is the research and development of a new source of fusion energy. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 1 168 800 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 576 600 000. This vote was a decision regarding discharge (non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While of course UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, UKIP’s general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and the EU spending British taxpayer’s money.

name: Marina Albiol Guzmán (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I voted against the ITER management report and the development of Fusion Energy due to the very high cost of this type of research.The European budget must be aimed at solving the many problems that European citizens are facing.I am not against the development of this type of research, but the Union has a budget that must be aimed at solving problems of a European nature.The high cost has been demonstrated shortly after its inception;It is an ambitious project that must be financed at the expense of fundamental policies for the citizens of the Union.I believe that the Union needs a much larger budget.Therefore, in this context, I cannot support a project with these characteristics.That is why I have decided to vote against this project.

name: Martina Anderson Lynn Boylan and Liadh Ní Riada (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – I voted against ITER’s closure of accounts for 2014 and against the resolution granting discharge for 2014 as to how the project has been handled, especially reflecting the large excessive amount of resources which have been allocated to it.

name: Νίκος Ανδρουλάκης (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the Second Report on the discharge for the implementation of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of nuclear fusion for the financial year 2014, because I support the actions of such Joint Undertakings in various fields, which offer muchbenefits in the daily lives of European citizens.

name: Marie-Christine Arnautu (ENF)
text: in writing. - This report calls for discharge for the implementation of the budget. The ITER Joint Undertaking is subject to criticism from the Court. Indeed, the report underlines the risks of cost overruns, which remain high. An ITER (governance) Council has been set up to address these planning weaknesses. Procurement procedures, which have been criticized in the past for their lack of rigor (or supplier compliance with project requirements), have been partially corrected. The report observes that the action plans are now better executed and closely monitored by the ITER organization and the Joint Undertaking. He adds that this should lead to improvements. Regarding the continuation of the project, the ITER Council confirmed in June 2016 that it is now going in the right direction, with a realistic timetable and reasonable associated costs. Of six of the deadlines assigned to Fusion For Energy, four have since been met. The report adds that the issue of the lease of the premises of the Joint Undertaking has been settled and welcomes the entry into force on 1 January 2016 of the new financial regulations of the Joint Undertaking as well as the new implementing rules. . I voted in favor of this report.

name: Jonathan Arnott (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ This decision is to grant discharge and close the accounts of ITER. This was set up in March 2007 for a period of 35 years. The members are represented by the Commission, the Member States of Euratom, and third countries which have concluded cooperation agreements with Euratom in the field of controlled nuclear fusion. The aim is to develop clean fusion power. The final 2014 budget available for implementation included commitment appropriations of EUR 1 168 800 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 576 600 000.

name: Jean Arthuis (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report as recommended by the committee responsible in its second reading, taking into account the receipt of additional evidence to justify and close the accounts on the implementation of the budget of the ITER Joint Undertaking and thedevelopment of fusion energy for the 2014 financial year.

name: Zigmantas Balčytis (S&D)
text: in writing.- The members of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy are Euratom, represented by the Commission, the Euratom Member States and other third countries which have concluded cooperation agreements with Euratom in the field of controlled nuclear fusion.In its report on the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, the Court found that its financial position for 2014 was presented correctly, as required by its financial rules.

name: Gerard Batten (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ITER. Discharge is a procedure whereby the European Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on their implementation. ITER was set up in March 2007 for a period of 35 years and involves the Commission, Member States and third countries. The aim is the research and development of a new source of fusion energy. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 1 168 800 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 576 600 000. This vote was on a decision regarding discharge (a non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While, of course, UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, its general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and to the EU spending British taxpayers’ money.

name: Nicolas Bay (ENF)
text: in writing.- Although there are still some shortcomings, the ITER Joint Undertaking has shown significant efforts which have already yielded convincing results, which should lead to further improvements for the great project it is carrying.Of six of the deadlines assigned to Fusion For Energy, four have since been met.The report adds that the issue of the lease of the premises of the Joint Undertaking has been settled and welcomes the entry into force on 1 January 2016 of the new financial regulations of the Joint Undertaking as well as the new implementing rules..It is on the basis of this progress that I am voting in favor of granting discharge for the implementation of the budget of the Joint Undertaking.

name: Hugues Bayet (S&D)
text: in writing.- In accordance with the proposal of the Committee on Budgetary Control, I voted in favor of the discharge for ITER for the financial year 2014.

name: Brando Benifei (S&D)
text: in writing.- The budget discharge procedure represents an important moment in the institutional life of the European Union.On this occasion, the European Parliament, the only institution elected by universal suffrage by the citizens, decides on the recommendation of the Council whether or not to guarantee the final approval of the implementation of the budget for a given financial year.This is a fundamental step which is also an opportunity to address specific recommendations to the institutions and agencies that make up the structure of the Union.Following the advice of the Committee on Budgetary Control (CONT), today I decided to vote in favor of the Marinescu report granting discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of fusion energy for the execution of thebudget of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Xabier Benito Ziluaga (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- In relation to the ITER report, the CONT report assesses the efficiency, transparency and regularity of the ITER accounts.This is the second report, because the decision was postponed in spring.I am voting against, because despite the fact that some papers have been put into order, ITER continues to be an inefficient waste of resources for a dubious, centralizing project with high opportunity costs.Therefore I vote against the approval of the discharge.

name: Izaskun Bilbao Barandica (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report on ITER's 2014 discharge.It is noted that, as a result of the challenges currently facing the project, the new director submitted to the ITER Council an action plan that included specific measures to resolve the main constraints that are affecting the development of the project.

name: Dominique Bilde (ENF)
text: in writing. - I welcome this report which recommends granting discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ITER Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 and which I therefore supported. Of course, as the Court of Auditors has repeatedly emphasized, it is necessary to be vigilant as to the risks of cost overruns, despite the establishment of an internal financing fund supposed to compensate for possible hazards in the progress of the project. But it should be remembered that these risks are due to the very nature of the project. Furthermore, it should be noted that the problems related to procurement procedures have been partially resolved. Finally, the conclusions of the ITER Council, which met in June 2016, should be taken into account, which noted that the project is now heading in the right direction, thanks in particular to a realistic timetable and reasonable associated costs. For example, out of six of the deadlines assigned to Fusion for Energy, four have already been met. We must recognize the progress made by ITER on financial management issues, in particular with the entry into force of its new financial regulations.

name: Mara Bizzotto (ENF)
text: in writing.- The report offers very good points of criticism which led me to vote against granting discharge.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: written.- I have voted in favor of the discharge of the director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy in the execution of the budget of said Company for the financial year 2014, in view of the report prepared by theBudgetary Control Committee, which verifies that the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking faithfully present, in all significant aspects, its financial situation as of December 31, 2014 and the results of its operations and cash flows for the year ended, in accordance withthe provisions of its Financial Regulations.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report, which deals with the 2014 Discharge for the implementation of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy. The European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy (hereinafter referred to as "the Joint Undertaking") was established in 2007. March. For a period of 35 years. The members of the Joint Undertaking shall be Euratom, represented by the Commission, the Euratom Member States and other third countries which have concluded cooperation agreements with Euratom in the field of controlled nuclear fusion. This joint venture became self-employed in 2008. March. The European Parliament notes that the Court of Auditors, in its report on the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, stated that the financial statements of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 31 December and the results of operations and cash flows relating to the financial year ended on that date are presented in all material respects as required by its financial regulations.

name: Franc Bogovič (PPE)
text: in writing.- I support the discharge for the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy.The financial situation was in accordance with the provisions of the financial rules and there were no irregularities.The new Director-General of ITER also responded to the challenges currently facing the project and presented an action plan that includes specific measures to address the main obstacles affecting project development.It is noted that the intermediate targets set by the ITER Council at its meeting on 18 and 19 November 2015 are very advanced and that four of the six targets set for the 2016 merger have already been met.

name: Biljana Borzan (S&D)
text: written.- I support this 2014 Discharge Report for the Joint Undertaking for ITER and Fusion Energy Development.Joint Undertakings bring together industries and research bodies into public-private partnerships to support research, new technologies and demonstration activities and accelerate the market introduction of individual technologies.Domains include air traffic control, carbon energy, nanotechnology, computer technology, cleaner aviation technology, and nuclear fusion.I support JUS in its many areas of work that are beneficial to EU citizens.

name: Marie-Christine Boutonnet (ENF)
text: in writing.- This report recommends granting discharge for the implementation of the ITER budget.While shortcomings had previously been noted in the management of this joint venture, the report recognizes that serious progress has since been made.Therefore, I vote in favor.

name: Renata Briano (S&D)
text: in writing. - Parliament grants discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy in respect of the implementation of the Joint Undertaking's budget for the financial year 2014 and approves the closure of the Joint Undertaking's accounts for the financial year 2014. financial year 2014. Parliament notes that the Court of Auditors has stated that the Joint Undertaking's annual accounts faithfully present its financial position as of 31 December 2014, as well as the results of its operations and cash flows. Parliament noted that the new Director-General of the ITER organization presented to the ITER Board an action plan including specific measures to overcome the main obstacles to the development of the ITER project and also notes that the new acting Director developed an action plan for the Joint Undertaking which is largely in line with that of the ITER organization. This action plan has received full approval from the Governing Board of the Joint Undertaking and, since March 2015, the ITER organization and the Joint Undertaking have been implementing and following closely the action plans and therefore Parliament invites the company common to submit a report on the implementation of these action plans.

name: Steeve Briois (ENF)
text: in writing. - The ITER Joint Undertaking is very strongly criticized by the Court of Justice of the Union. Despite the establishment of an internal financing fund intended to compensate for possible contingencies in the progress of the project, the report underlines the risks of cost overruns which remain high. The report specifies that the cost estimates are systematically lower than the costs encountered. Regarding the continuation of the project, the ITER Council confirmed in June 2016 that it is now going in the right direction, with a realistic timetable and reasonable associated costs. Of six of the deadlines assigned to Fusion For Energy, four have since been met. The report adds that the issue of the lease of the premises of the Joint Undertaking has been settled and welcomes the entry into force on 1 January 2016 of the new financial regulations of the Joint Undertaking as well as the new implementing rules. . That’s why I voted in favor of this report granting budgetary discharge.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: signed up. - The Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy was established in March 2007 for a period of 35 years, the members of the Joint Undertaking being Euratom, represented by the Commission, Euratom Member States and third countries which have concluded cooperation agreements with Euratom in the field of controlled nuclear fusion. Following the checks carried out, it was found that the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy has accounts which provide a true and fair view of the financial situation and results of its operations, as well as the cash flows for the financial year 2014, in accordance with with the provisions of its financial rules. I spoke in favor of the discharge report for the implementation of the budget of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and for the development of fusion energy for the financial year 2014, as I believe that this undertaking managed the funds available in an efficient and transparent manner, permanently achieving the purpose for which it was established.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of the report in question because the report drawn up by the Court of Auditors shows that the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 faithfully present its financial position as at 31 December 2014. The final financial envelope available for 2014 includes commitment appropriations of € 1 168 800 000 and payment appropriations equivalent to € 567 600 000. The utilization rates for commitment and payment appropriations are 100% and 88.5% respectively. It is also noted that the expected execution rate for the payment appropriations indicated in the initial budget for 2014 is 73%. The conclusions of the ITER Council of 15 and 16 June 2016 confirmed that the ITER project is moving in the right direction, allowing the elaboration of a valid and realistic proposal regarding the timetable and associated costs. In addition, the updated integrated timetable for the ITER project was approved, setting the date for the first plasma in September 2025. So far, all project milestones have been completed on schedule, if not early.

name: Matt Carthy (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against ITER’s closure of accounts for 2014 and against the resolution granting discharge for 2014 as to how the project has been handled, especially reflecting the excessive amount of resources which have been allocated to it.

name: David Casa (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as I believe that the updated integrated schedule for the ITER project for the development of fusion energy is challenging but achievable according to the ITER Council Review Group. The project has previously experienced serious delays and cost—overturns, but I believe that the evidence of improved decision making and better understanding of the risks provides a renewed basis of confidence.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing.- In 2014, the Joint Undertaking's internal audit structure carried out a review of the monitoring of contract execution highlighting the existence of important risk factors such as unrealistic timetable for projects and delays in the implementation of activities.The company was having difficulty effectively limiting some of these risks, as they were attributable to the ITER Organization which has now changed.Finally, the review identified the need for more robust controls and process changes, in particular with regard to management and change control, financial management of contracts and management of non-compliance situations.Together with the M5S delegation, I voted against granting discharge.

name: Λευτέρης Χριστοφόρου (PPE)
text: in writing.- We approve the closure of the accounts of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of nuclear fusion for the financial year 2014.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. - The granting of the discharge of the budget for the financial year 2014 to an occasion of public-private partnership with such an impact opens for profound reflection and requires careful analysis. From my point of view, there can only be guarantees and enthusiasm in voting for a measure of this kind thanks to the report of the Court of Auditors. In fact, it is possible to read that the annual accounts of the joint venture faithfully present the financial position of the same as at 31 December 2014, moreover the results of its operations and the cash flows comply with the provisions of the company's financial regulation. The final financial envelope available for 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 1 168 800 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 567 600 000. To clarify, ITER is a global collaborative project that aims to become the largest experimental fusion facility in the world and is designed to demonstrate the scientific and technological feasibility of fusion, the process that powers the Sun and the stars. Fusion research is aimed at developing a safe, limitless and environmentally responsible energy source. A stimulus for new jobs and growth will also be acquired through ITER.

name: Deirdre Clune (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the second report on discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014 and noted no objections.

name: Carlos Coelho (PPE)
text: in writing.- According to the Court of Auditors' report on the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014, the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking faithfully reflect, in all material respects, the financial situation at 31 December 2014, as well asas the result of its operations and cash flows for the year ended on that date, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations.In this regard, I support the Marinescu report, which authorizes the discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITRE and the development of Fusion Energy for the implementation of the Budget of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014 and after the opinions of the Court of Auditors on the reliability of the accounts 2014 andon the legality and regularity of the transactions, which certified the correctness of the expenses incurred and recorded by the director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER.

name: Javier Couso Permuy (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I voted against the ITER management report and the development of Fusion Energy due to the very high cost of this type of research.The European budget must be aimed at solving the many problems that European citizens are facing.I am not against the development of this type of research, but the Union has a budget that must be aimed at solving problems of a European nature.The high cost has been demonstrated shortly after its inception;It is an ambitious project that must be financed at the expense of fundamental policies for the citizens of the Union.I believe that the Union needs a much larger budget.Therefore, in this context, I cannot support a project of this nature.That is why I have decided to vote against this project.

name: Andrea Cozzolino (S&D)
text: in writing.- I think it is important to point out that the Court of Auditors has drawn up a very positive report on the annual accounts of the joint venture regarding the operations and cash flows of the year.At the same time, it is positive that important steps forward have been noted with regard to managerial programs, costs and the planned timetable.There also seems to be a positive collaboration between the ITER organization and national agencies, which allows for compliance with the program and the objectives set.I therefore vote in favor of the text, noting the positive factors regarding the execution of the program and the management of funds and resources, as well as the managerial organization, as drawn up by the Court of Auditors.

name: Edward Czesak (ECR)
text: in writing.- I voted against the 2014 discharge report, namely the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy, with the result that I have not granted a discharge.I do not see any progress in this endeavor.I am not convinced by the arguments that the failure to grant discharge in spring 2016 was only due to a lack of information necessary to calculate the error rate for Member States' audits and a different error calculation system.For this reason, I voted against the discharge report.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of this discharge as the Joint Undertaking’s annual accounts were presented fairly, in all material respects and its financial position together with the results of its operations and its cash flows are in accordance with the provisions of its financial rules. I am positive that the action plan provided by the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER identifies further improvements in the Undertaking’s own operations in the development of fusion energy.

name: Daniel Dalton (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to postpone discharge again on this report because the European Court of Auditors did not give the EU budget as a whole a positive statement of assurance. The level of error for the year 2014 was estimated to be 4.4%, which, whilst a slight improvement on 2013, is still too high. It is the job of Parliament to verify that the EU budget was spent in accordance with the rules and in line with the principles of sound financial management, and unfortunately the Court of Auditors found that was not the case for the year 2014. We need more simplification of key areas of financial management in the EU budget and a stronger focus on tackling parts of the budget with a higher risk of problems.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (ENF)
text: in writing. - Despite the creation of an internal financing fund, intended to compensate for any contingencies in the progress of the project, the report underlines the risks of cost overruns, which remain high. An ITER Governance Council has been set up to address these planning weaknesses. Procurement procedures have been partially improved. The report states that the cost estimates are systematically lower than reality. Despite the development of a cost management system, many shortcomings remain in the quality of the project organization. The report nevertheless observes that the action plans are now better executed and closely monitored by the ITER organization and the Joint Undertaking. Regarding the continuation of the project, the ITER Council confirmed in June 2016 that it had a realistic schedule and reasonable associated costs. Of six of the deadlines assigned to Fusion For Energy, four have since been met. The report adds that the issue of the lease of the premises of the Joint Undertaking has been settled and welcomes the entry into force on 1 January 2016 of the new financial regulations of the Joint Undertaking as well as the new implementing rules. . Also, I voted for.

name: Γεώργιος Επιτήδειος (NI)
text: in writing.- The reported data must be sufficient, accompanied by actions to correct previous remarks, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective operations.

name: Jill Evans (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against the discharge of ITER  because there have been further delays over costs, which affects other aspects of the EU budget and which in turn affects my constituents in Wales. We have yet to see the new project plan.

name: José Manuel Fernandes (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy was established in March 2007 for a period of 35 years.The final budget for 2014 included EUR 1 168 800 000 in commitment appropriations and EUR 567 600 000 in payment appropriations.The implementation rates for commitment and payment appropriations were, respectively, 100% and 88.5%, however, the implementation rate for payment appropriations in relation to the initial 2014 budget was only 73%.

name: Edouard Ferrand (ENF)
text: in writing.- Vote for: Regarding the continuation of the project, the ITER Council confirmed in June 2016 that it is now going in the right direction, with a realistic timetable and reasonable associated costs.Of the 6 deadlines assigned to Fusion For Energy, 4 have since been met.The report adds that the issue of the lease of the premises of the Joint Undertaking has been settled and welcomes the entry into force on 1 January 2016 of the new financial regulations of the Joint Undertaking as well as the new implementing rules..

name: João Ferreira (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - The European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy was created in March 2007 for a period of 35 years. This company has as members Euratom, represented by the European Commission, Euratom Member States and third countries that have concluded cooperation agreements in the field of controlled nuclear fusion with Euratom. ITER is an international collaborative project that aims to develop fusion energy. The conclusions of the ITER Council of June 2016 confirm that the ITER project is now in the right direction, which allows the presentation of a solid, realistic and detailed proposal for the timetable and associated costs up to the first plasma (2025), support the updated integrated calendar, indicate that the successful completion of all stages of the project, on schedule or earlier, is a positive indicator of the collective capacity of the ITER Organization and national agencies to continue to comply with the updated integrated calendar and underline that greater efficiency in decision-making processes, a better understanding of risks and greater rigor in the respect of commitments contribute to the ITER project maintaining its current positive dynamics. Our vote on this report is inseparable from the position we have taken on the ITER project.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (NI)
text: in writing. - I am voting in favor of the second report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of nuclear fusion for the financial year 2014, as the information provided should be sufficient, accompanied by remedial action, in order to accept the exemption for the financial year 2014, without leaving a trace of doubt as to the legality of the respective operations. At this stage, the new Director-General of the ITER Agency has submitted to the ITER Council an action plan which includes concrete measures to address the key obstacles currently affecting the progress of the project, which are being implemented and closely monitored and led to the successful completion of all project milestones to date, on time or earlier than originally planned.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)

Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. I support the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Arne Gericke (ECR)
text: written.- I voted for the discharge of the joint undertaking for ITER and the development of fusion energy, as I consider this area and this research project itself to be an important institution that needs to be supported and promoted across borders.

name: Jens Gieseke (PPE)
text: written.- The development of new, alternative energy sources is indispensable in order to ensure the security of electricity supply throughout Europe in the future.I am therefore voting in favor of relieving the joint undertaking for the ITER and the associated further research and development of fusion energy.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- In relation to the ITER report, the CONT report assesses the efficiency, transparency and regularity of the ITER accounts.This is the second report, because the decision was postponed in spring.I am voting against, because despite the fact that some papers have been regulated, ITER continues to be an inefficient waste of resources for a doubtful, centralizing project with high opportunity costs.Therefore I vote against the approval of the discharge.

name: Antanas Guoga (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. The European Parliament granted a discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014.

name: Τάκης Χατζηγεωργίου (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- Our disagreement with nuclear power plants is clear.That is why we voted against the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of nuclear fusion for 2014.

name: Marian Harkin (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report, which granted the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy discharge in respect of the implementation of the Joint Undertaking’s budget for the financial year 2014. This allowed Parliament to close the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for 2014. In addition, I was happy to support a number of comments included in the report, such as that the ITER Project is now going in the right direction, in a way that will allow for a sound, realistic and detailed proposal for schedule and indicated that the successful completion of all project milestones to date, on or ahead of schedule, is a positive indicator. I also welcome the fact that the milestones set up at the ITER Council meeting of 18 and 19 November 2015 are well advanced and that four out of the six milestones attributed to Fusion for Energy (F4E) for 2016 have already been fulfilled. Finally, I was happy that the issue of the lease of the premises of the Joint Undertaking has been solved, as the Spanish Government offered a long-term lease agreement for the current premises and an extension of the current office space by one additional floor.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the second discharge report for the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014, as the discharge and authorization of the accounts allow the European Joint Undertaking to proceed smoothly.It was established that the annual accounting documentation realistically and consistently shows the financial condition of the company and that the ITER project is moving in the right direction.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the discharge for the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy.The discharge was granted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: written.- The ITER project has faced enormous challenges from the very beginning.This has sometimes led to delays and budget overruns.Although an action plan has now been presented with targeted measures to remove the main current obstacles to the project's progress, it is doubtful whether this project will still serve its purpose.That is why I would have voted against the discharge report.

text: in writing.- I voted for this text because the ITER Council took into account the criticisms of the Court of Auditors and presented a realistic timetable.

Indeed, despite the establishment of an internal financing fund, intended to compensate for any contingencies in the progress of the project, the report underlines the risks of cost overruns, which remain high. These risks are inherent in the nature of the project, itself quite complex, and in the regular evolution of its field of intervention. An ITER (governance) Council has been set up to address these planning weaknesses. Despite the establishment of a cost management system, many shortcomings remain in the quality of the project organization. The report nevertheless observes that the action plans are now better executed and closely monitored by the ITER organization and the Joint Undertaking. Regarding the continuation of the project, the ITER Council confirmed in June 2016 that it is now going in the right direction, with a realistic timetable and reasonable associated costs. With the report calling for discharge, I voted in favor.

name: Javi López (S&D)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the discharge of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy because, although approval was not given in April because the annual report of the Court of Auditors had indicated that it was notit had the necessary information to calculate the error rate after audits carried out by the Member States, as its calculation methods had changed.Additional documents sent this time by the national authorities have shown that the calculations were correct

name: Paloma López Bermejo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I voted against the ITER management report and the development of Fusion Energy due to the very high cost of this type of research.The European budget must be aimed at solving the many problems that European citizens are facing.I am not against the development of this type of research, but the Union has a budget that must be aimed at solving problems of a European nature.The high cost has been demonstrated shortly after its inception;It is an ambitious project that must be financed at the expense of fundamental policies for the citizens of the Union.I believe that the Union needs a much larger budget.Therefore, in this context, I cannot support a project with these characteristics.That is why I have decided to vote against this project.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: in writing.- I stayed.The final accounts appear to be in order, they have been examined by the Court of Auditors of the EU.ITER is an intergovernmental organization where the Member States, in addition to the EU (Euratom) members, are India, Japan, Russia, the USA and China.The project deals with nuclear fusion research and is governed by the intergovernmental principle.

name: Monica Macovei (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ ITER (International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor) is an international nuclear fusion research project. The experimental reactor will be able to produce more energy than the priming process would consume. Given that, the quantity of fuel in the reactor (approximately 1 gram as against 100 tons in fission) is very limited, and in the event of a malfunction, the plasma is turned off without any risk. I welcome the position of the ITER Council on keeping risks at a minimum. I welcome, too, the fact that an action plan has been presented and an updated schedule approved. The planned programmes for implementation of the project are widely respected: we are moving in the right direction.

name: Ivana Maletić (PPE)
text: written.- The European Parliament gives a discharge to the Executive Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the implementation of the budget and closure of the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.major constraints affecting project development, I supported this report.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (ECR)
text: in writing.- I am voting against the second report on the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of nuclear fusion for the financial year 2014, because it is not complete and substantiated and for the reasons I have given in detail in my speechat the Plenary Session of the European Parliament in Strasbourg on 26 October 2016.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted for this text.It seems to me legitimate to grant discharge for the implementation of the budget of this Joint Undertaking.Recently, management has improved following serious checks which clearly revealed the shortcomings in the organization of the project.

name: Valentinas Mazuronis (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I supported the EP report on the discharge for the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014.This company was established in 2007.March.For a period of 35 years.Its members are Euratom, represented by the Commission, Euratom Member States and other third countries which have concluded cooperation agreements with Euratom in the field of controlled nuclear fusion.The Court of Auditors stated in its report that the company's financial statements, financial position and results of operations and cash flows, present fairly, in all material respects, as required by its financial regulations.The EP therefore approves the closure of the accounts of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- This report gives discharge for the execution of its 2014 budget to the ITER Joint Undertaking, created to develop a new generation European nuclear reactor.I criticized the scale and the recurrence of European investments in nuclear power, while renewable energies remain the poor relations of European energy policy.So I voted against this budget and logically vote against this discharge report.

name: Nuno Melo (PPE)
text: in writing.- All European institutions that depend on the budget of the European Union must be strictly supervised by the Court of Auditors and by all entities with this function.It is necessary to assess whether Community funds are being used well, whether these institutions are complying with the objectives set and whether there is no waste of resources.In general, with few exceptions, to be assessed by the inspections that are known, we can say that the institutions in question are using the funds made available correctly and complying with the proposed objectives.I therefore vote in favor of the discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the implementation of the budget of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Roberta Metsola (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the discharge in respect of the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: in writing.- On the basis of the positive development of the Joint Undertaking for ITER, thanks in particular to its encouraging results relating to the completion of all stages of the project on the planned date and to the facilities it was able to obtain from the Spanish government inAs regards the lease and premises, I voted for discharge on the implementation of the budget of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of fusion energy.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report because joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies, which is essential. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, and nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: in writing.- The EP postponed the decision on the discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Implementation of the Budget of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014 in respect of the implementation of its budget.In its second report, the Committee on Budgetary Control now proposes that Parliament approve the closure of the accounts of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014.I voted accordingly.

name: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar (PPE)
text: in writing.- In view of the foregoing in this report, it deserves my favorable vote, in the sense of giving discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the implementation of the Joint Undertaking's budget for the financial year 2014.the observations / suggestions presented should be taken into account in the future.

name: Claude Moraes (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Joint undertakings bring together industry and research bodies in public-private partnerships to support research, new technology and demonstration activities and to accelerate the market introduction of specific technologies, which is essential. Fields covered include air traffic control, carbon-lean energy, and nanotechnology, computing technology, cleaner aviation technologies and nuclear fusion. Our Group supports the joint undertakings in their many areas of work which are of clear benefit to EU citizens.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this text.The granting of discharge, initially foreseen during the plenary session in April, had been postponed because ITER had not transmitted certain information necessary for this grant.This information has since been correctly communicated to the CONT committee.Therefore, there is no longer any objection to our granting both discharges.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Each year the European Parliament takes a decision, following a recommendation from the Council, regarding the discharge for budget implementation, through which it releases the Commission from its responsibility for managing the given budget for a specific year by marking the end of its execution. I voted for the 2014 discharge in respect of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy.

name: Franz Obermayr (ENF)
text: written.- Due to the enormous challenges that this project has to contend with from the start, which have sometimes led to delays and budget overruns, I doubt whether this project will still serve its purpose and I have spoken out against this report.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I supported.The 2014 budget for ITER and the development of fusion energy has been implemented and can be considered as approved.

name: Margot Parker (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ITER. Discharge is a procedure whereby the European Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on their implementation. ITER was set up in March 2007 for a period of 35 years and involves the Commission, Member States and third countries. The aim is the research and development of a new source of fusion energy. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 1 168 800 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 576 600 000. This vote was on a decision regarding discharge (a non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body. While, of course, UKIP supports international cooperation on issues such as this on a bilateral basis, its general position on discharge votes is to refuse the granting of discharge, in order to register our opposition to EU bodies and to the EU spending British taxpayers’ money.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing.- Considering that the objectives set during the ITER board meeting of 18 and 19 November 2015 have been largely achieved and that four of the six milestones assigned to "Fusion for Energy" (F4E) for 2016 have already been achieved, in referenceto the proposal for a European Parliament decision on discharge for the implementation of the budget of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014 I would like to say positively.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: written. - The European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy is an international enterprise in which, in addition to EU Member States, significant economic powers such as the USA, India, Japan, Russia and China also participate. As a European contribution to ITER, the EU approved EUR 6.6 billion in 2008. The Court of Auditors' finding shows that this amount is twice as high as the initial budget expenditure and does not include the amount of EUR 663 000 000 proposed by the Commission to cover any unforeseen expenditure. Significant increases in project costs could jeopardize other programs that are also funded from the Union budget. Moreover, in November 2014, the Joint Undertaking estimated that, based on the November 2014 calculations, the shortfall (“adverse contingencies”) by the end of the construction phase was EUR 428 000 000. Although the approval of the ITER Discharge was postponed in May 2016 due to all the above, in June 2016 the ITER Council confirmed the upgrade of the integrated schedule. The ITER Council Review Group stated that the schedule was demanding but achievable. A sharp focus placed on the basic elements will effectively reduce the risks of the project. Evidence of improved decision-making, better understanding of risk, and compliance should provide a renewed foundation of trust. I therefore support the approval of the Discharge for the implementation of the budget of the ITER Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014.

name: Tonino Picula (S&D)
text: written. - Due to the challenges currently facing the ITER project, the new Director General of the ITER Organization presented to the ITER Council an action plan with concrete measures to address the main constraints that currently affect the development of the project. I welcome the conclusions of the ITER Council adopted on 15 and 16 June 2016, which confirmed that the ITER project is moving in the right direction, which will enable a sound, achievable and detailed proposal of the schedule and associated costs until the creation of the first plasma. The creation of the first plasma is scheduled for December 2025, and the successful completion of all key project stages within or before the project is a positive indicator of the joint capacity of the ITER Organization and domestic agencies to continue adhering to the schedule. I am convinced that the ITER project will continue to be implemented at the current positive pace. I welcome the position of the ITER Council that focusing on the core elements through the first plasma should effectively reduce the risk of the ITER project. I must emphasize how important this project is for the future of Europe and the world, how necessary it is to maintain a high level of global cooperation on this issue. I am proud of the important role of the EU within the project, our leadership on the road to the future of energy.

name: João Pimenta Lopes (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- The ITER project is an international collaborative project that aims to develop fusion energy.According to the Court of Auditors' report on the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy for the financial year 2014, the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking faithfully reflect, in all materially relevant aspects, its situationon December 31, 2014, as well as the results of its operations and cash flows for the year ended on that date, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations.

name: Miroslav Poche (S&D)
text: in writing. - As the shadow rapporteur for the budget discharge of the ITER Joint Undertaking, I pay particular and detailed attention to this issue. ITER has undergone difficult developments and has experienced a number of time delays and excessive costs in the past. This is one of the reasons why fundamental changes were introduced in 2015 in the management of ITER and the European company F4E, which represents the EU in ITER. The results of the first changes were already brought in 2015, and in particular the first half of 2016. The postponement of the deferred budget discharge for 2014 was conditional on the ITER Council approving the ITER Long-Term Action Plan in mid-June 2016. . Anyone who has had the opportunity to visit the ITER design site will not shy away from the strong monstrosity and complexity of the project as well as the technological marvels that are happening before his eyes. I am all the more aware of how difficult it is to create and, above all, adhere to the budget plan and the work plan. ITER will once again stand out in the forthcoming discharge process, and I, as the rapporteur for the 2015 discharge, will therefore pay particular attention to it.

name: Salvatore Domenico Pogliese (PPE)
text: in writing.- The motion for a resolution welcomes the ITER Council conclusions of 15 and 16 June 2016, which confirmed that the ITER project is currently moving in the right direction.I believe that the European Parliament should grant discharge to the Director of the European ITER Joint Undertaking for the implementation of the budget for the financial year 2014.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of granting the 2014 discharge to the ITER project (civil nuclear fusion research reactor, 35 participating countries), which is a technical vote following the recommendations of the Committee on Budgetary Control.

name: Paulo Rangel (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy was created in March 2007 for a period of 35 years.Its constituent members are Eurotom, represented by the Commission, Euratom Member States and third countries which have concluded cooperation agreements in the field of nuclear fusion with Euratom.According to the Court of Auditors' report, the annual accounts of the Joint Undertaking faithfully reflect, in all material respects, its financial situation as at 31 December 2014, as well as the results of its operations and cash flows for the yearclosed on that date, in accordance with the provisions of its financial regulations.This report authorizes the discharge to the Director of the European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the development of Fusion Energy for the implementation of the Budget of the Joint Undertaking for the financial year 2014. I support this report.

name: Julia Reid (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this decision to grant discharge and close the accounts for ITER. Discharge is a procedure whereby the European Parliament looks at the internal budgets of each EU agency and institution and gives an opinion on their implementation. ITER was set up in March 2007 for a period of 35 years and involves the Commission, Member States and third countries. The aim is the research and development of a new source of fusion energy. The final budget for the financial year 2014 included commitment appropriations of EUR 1 168 800 000 and payment appropriations of EUR 576 600 000. This vote was on a decision regarding discharge (a non-binding opinion) and a decision on closing the accounts for the relevant body.
