text: in writing. - I preferred to abstain from this resolution concerning European voluntary service, which is another example of the capacity of European institutions to take a good idea and turn it into a Trojan horse in the service of their federalist ideology. While everyone agrees to recognize the benefits of volunteering - whether for society as a whole or for the volunteer himself, who acquires valuable technical and human skills - there was no need for Parliament to sit down. take up this subject in order to call for the creation of a European civic service or a “European Solidarity Corps”. As I recalled in plenary, wanting to use volunteering to promote European citizenship means forgetting that citizenship is legally and essentially linked to nationality, this nationality which bothers them because it prevents them from building a European Federal State. On the other hand, MEPs have the indecency to praise the importance of volunteers in managing the refugee crisis: is it really up to civil society to manage the slump that European politicians have created? It is the admission of their total irresponsibility in the management of a disaster that they have fostered!

name: Mara Bizzotto (ENF)
text: in writing.- I appreciate and support the role of volunteering in civil society, but I believe that it is not the task of the Union to define its activities, given that the action of volunteers is linked to the territory in which they operate and for this reason it is unrealistic to believe that we canhigh a unique model.I therefore preferred to abstention this motion for a resolution.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: written.- Volunteering is one of the most visible expressions of solidarity, which produces a transforming effect in society through the construction of social capital and social inclusion, in addition to constituting an expression of freedom and responsibility that puts values into practiceEuropeans.This proposal for a Resolution, born in the heat of the 20th anniversary of EVS, calls for strengthening the support mechanisms and organizational structures, by strengthening an appropriate legal framework that determines the rights and responsibilities of volunteers..It also calls for reinforcing the monitoring and local dimension after a volunteer experience abroad by supporting local communities.For all these reasons, I have voted in favor of this motion for a resolution to draw up a coordinated European volunteering policy and for EVS to receive a greater boost from the institutions.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this resolution on the promotion of European voluntary service and volunteering in Europe. The European Parliament recognizes that volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility and that it contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and personal development, as well as being a vital tool for social inclusion and cohesion, training, education and intercultural dialogue; that it makes a significant contribution to the dissemination of European values. It also emphasizes that its benefits as a strategic tool for promoting mutual understanding and intercultural relations are also recognized in voluntary activities with third countries. Parliament emphasized the importance of establishing a European Voluntary Service framework as a legal basis for determining the status of volunteering (with corresponding rights and obligations), facilitating mobility and recognizing skills. He therefore calls on those Member States that have yet to establish a legal environment for volunteers to make use of the recommendations set out in the European Voluntary Policy Agenda and the European Charter on the Rights and Responsibilities of Volunteers. It also calls on the Member States to implement specific approval processes in accordance with the 2012 Council Recommendation to ensure a better understanding and comparability of competences and skills.

name: Andrea Bocskor (PPE)
text: in writing. - In Europe, almost 100 million citizens of all ages volunteer and their work contributes to around 5% of EU GDP. The Commission should take into account the economic value of the products and services provided by volunteers when formulating a policy that focuses more on volunteers. It is important that European Voluntary Service is based on the provision of quality volunteer places and respects the Charter for Volunteers and the principles of the Quality Charter for Student Mobility. It is also necessary for the European Voluntary Service to be based on a structure that encourages voluntary organizations to become host organizations, thus providing them with appropriate support and training, while strengthening the role of coordinating organizations that support a large number of host organizations, such as administration and training. . In the light of the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Franc Bogovič (PPE)
text: in writing.- I support the motion for a resolution on voluntary European service.Through the practice in the home country, we can see that volunteering has an important role in the expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility, and helps to strengthen active citizenship and contribute to personal human development.It is an important tool for social inclusion, training, education and intercultural dialogue.If we succeed in redirecting these values to the European space, we will be able to create a European identity more easily and effectively, thus contributing to the spread of European values.In doing so, it is important to provide a European framework for voluntary activities that defines rights and responsibilities and promotes mobility and the recognition of skills.It is therefore a good proposal to support and implement the idea of co-financing voluntary work with EU grants, as recently proposed by the Commission in its proposal for a new Financial Regulation.

name: Biljana Borzan (S&D)
text: written.- I support this Report on European Voluntary Service.Volunteering deserves to be a top topic in political debates.I therefore welcome the initiative for a leading role for the European Parliament in this important topic for all Europeans.

name: Renata Briano (S&D)
text: in writing. - The current refugee crisis is a blatant symbol of the importance of volunteers and the way they embody European values. The European Parliament recognizes that volunteering is a manifestation of solidarity, freedom and responsibility which contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and personal human development and that it represents an essential tool for social inclusion and cohesion, training, education and intercultural dialogue. It argues that a European framework for volunteering activities is needed, as a legal framework defining the status of a volunteer, indicating their rights and duties, and facilitating mobility and the recognition of skills; and that it is necessary for each Member State to establish national voluntary service programs with adequate resources. He supports the Commission's idea of ​​setting up the EU Solidarity Corps, a new European volunteering initiative for young people. It also encourages Member States to promote European Voluntary Service in their education and academic systems. Finally, he believes that the communication strategy on European voluntary service must be improved and reshaped, highlighting the social, human and civil value of volunteering.

name: Alain Cadec (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European voluntary service has already existed for twenty years.During these years, 100,000 young people participated in this program and undertook volunteer activities all over the world.Volunteering is an act of citizenship and solidarity which fully contributes to the social and societal integration of individuals.The European Union must continue to support voluntary actions such as European voluntary service.It is important to provide appropriate funding and organizational clarification to European volunteering programs.I voted in favor of this resolution.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of the resolution in question which calls for the coordination and harmonization of European policies on volunteering. The European voluntary service represents one of the most evident manifestations of solidarity and contributes significantly to the dissemination of European values. The report highlights, in particular, the importance of preparing a European legal framework for voluntary activities which defines the status of volunteer, indicating their rights and duties, and which facilitates mobility and the recognition of skills; in the meantime, it encourages Member States that have not yet established a legal framework for volunteers to make use of the recommendations contained in the Political Agenda for Volunteering in Europe and the European Charter of Volunteers' Rights and Responsibilities. The invitation addressed to Member States is to adopt the system developed by the ILO so that the economic value of volunteering can be measured and to collaborate with Eurostat for the development of indicators and new measurement methods aimed at collecting comparative data.

name: Matt Carthy (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution, which recognises the positive work done by volunteers across the EU, and calls for further support and access to EU funds for volunteers and their organisations. I voted in favour of amendments proposed by my colleagues in GUE/NGL that included a call for recognition of the economic value volunteering in accordance with an ILO recommendation. I voted against certain aspects of the report calling for an EU legal framework for volunteers as I believe it should remain as a Member State competence. However, this was not a sufficient reason for not supporting the report, so I voted in favour.

name: David Casa (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution as I believe that it is important to provide a European framework for volunteering actions as a legal framework which identifies a volunteering status and facilitates mobility and recognition of skills. It is beneficial for Member States to implement concrete validation processes in the framework of the Council Recommendation of 2012 to ensure better understanding and comparability of skills and experience in volunteering. Member States that still need to define a legal environment for volunteers to use the recommendations in the Policy Agenda for Volunteering in Europe and the European Charter on the Rights and Responsibilities of Volunteers. Volunteering helps people to gain skills and competences that can facilitate their access to the labour market and they should never be considered or used as replacement labour.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing.- I believe that everyone should have the right to equal access to volunteering opportunities, as well as to the reconciliation of volunteering with their private and professional life.I therefore voted in favor of the resolution.

name: Caterina Chinnici (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Voluntary Service (EVS), which is turning 20 this year, allows young people between the ages of 17 and 30 to go abroad and take part in volunteer projects. I consider volunteering a noble activity as an expression of solidarity which also contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and the promotion of the culture of legality, and contrasts phenomena such as organized crime, social exclusion, poverty, intolerance, racism. , xenophobia and injustice. In this regard, I decided to vote in favor of the resolution as I believe that the Commission must update the framework concerning volunteering programs also in order to take into account the development of new digital technologies and the ongoing humanitarian crises within and within the outside the Union. In addition, the scope, sectors of activity, and destinations of the Voluntary Service, the extension of the program to third country nationals as well as the extension of the age range within which it is possible to apply would be appropriate. Finally, it seems to me appropriate for the Commission to promote a European civil service initiative by highlighting the skills that can be acquired in the course of experience.

name: Λευτέρης Χριστοφόρου (PPE)
text: in writing.- We call on the Member States to support the European Voluntary Service in their education and academic systems as a tool for disseminating education in solidarity and public participation to the younger generation.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. - Europe is plagued by deep wounds: the economic crisis and the high levels of unemployment have produced a gruesome increase in people in conditions of poverty and social exclusion, uncontrolled migratory flows expose every day to problems of all kinds. Where there is also very little trust in institutions, fortunately one can count on one resource: volunteering. It draws its power from the essence of the human soul and has no remuneration because its value itself is inestimable. Therefore, I am voting in favor of the resolution with the awareness that in these twenty years of European voluntary service it has been possible to advance an active citizenship as well as a profound personal development. In light of this, it is a priority to establish a European framework for voluntary activities that defines their rights and duties as well as facilitating interactions between individual initiatives and programs. The adoption of a European map would also allow for an facilitation of mobility between states according to the emergency situations to be addressed. Together, it would be possible to obtain a recognition of skills, which is essential to be able to better face adversity with a peaceful "legion" of prompt intervention. Therefore, I believe that involvement from an early age to active aging is fundamental: in fact, the best way to feel useful is by helping others.

name: Deirdre Clune (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the motion for a resolution on the European Voluntary Service and noted no objections.

name: Carlos Coelho (PPE)
text: in writing. - Volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and human development, being an essential instrument for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as for training, education and intercultural dialogue. I support this resolution because I believe that a coordinated volunteering policy is lacking in Europe and supporting the establishment of a European legal framework for volunteering actions that defines a voluntary status with rights and responsibilities and that facilitates mobility and the recognition of skills. Held by about 100 million European citizens, Volunteering not only promotes solidarity and social inclusion, creating social capital, but contributes to the production of approximately 5% of GDP. I therefore believe that it is essential to create a favorable environment for volunteering, either through its promotion by the Member States or by the European institutions, which guarantees the safe and sustainable functioning of the volunteering infrastructures, materializing the idea that volunteering benefits from EU grants for co-financing. Finally, I share the view that the European Voluntary Service's communication strategy must be redefined and refined by the Commission and the current application system should also be simplified.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the resolution as I agree with the need for a more coordinated European policy on volunteering and also simpler in the rules for access to this service.I agree on the possibility of using the volunteer programs for national projects financed by the EU structural funds.Volunteering can offer an important opportunity for young people to learn to acquire skills that will later be useful when they face the world of work.It is therefore necessary to prepare a European framework for voluntary activities which defines rights and duties and which facilitates mobility and the recognition of skills.

name: Javier Couso Permuy (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- Although I recognize the social value of volunteering, I have not been able to vote in favor of this resolution since it advocates a mercantilist consideration of European volunteering (which is quantified at 5% of GDP) which is used as a substitute for social services that mustbe public.I consider the voluntary work of thousands of citizens and residents of the Union laudable and as such must be socially recognized, but I oppose that volunteering serves as a pretext for the State to disregard its responsibilities, such as for example in the reception ofrefugees, which is the line in which the resolution is directed.For this reason, I have not been able to vote in favor of it.

name: Andrea Cozzolino (S&D)
text: in writing.- Nearly 100 million EU citizens have volunteered for programs covering education, culture, arts, sporting events, humanitarian aid and development.Despite the real social and economic benefits of volunteering, participation in the European Voluntary Service (EVS) remains modest and many obstacles still need to be removed.To this end, I believe it is essential to develop a more coordinated volunteering policy, based on a legal framework with clear rights and responsibilities for program managers and volunteers, and proper funding.On the latter point, I believe that organizations should also be encouraged to strengthen their participation in programs involving volunteers by allowing, among other things, to account for volunteering as a co-financing contribution for Member State projects linked to the EU structural funds..

name: Edward Czesak (ECR)
text: in writing.- On the resolution on the European Voluntary Service aimed at helping young people to participate in volunteering projects abroad lasting between 2 weeks and 12 months, I have chosen to abstain.The European Voluntary Service is part of the Erasmus + program, with objectives ranging from promoting social inclusion, solidarity, intercultural dialogue to projects to improve the competences and skills of young people.I support all activities aimed at developing young people's skills, but in terms of the effects and benefits of EVS, they are not very satisfactory.Therefore, I have decided to abstain.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of this report as it stresses the importance of volunteering and recognises its values and importance. Volunteering is an expression of solidarity which promotes and facilitates social inclusion. We need to promote creative and innovative solutions to common challenges, emphasising the need to have a combination of support mechanisms and appropriate structures that strengthen the legal framework, identifying the legal rights and responsibilities for volunteers.

name: Nicola Danti (S&D)
text: in writing. - With this resolution, Parliament confirms its vision of volunteering as an expression of community, freedom and responsibility aimed at strengthening active citizenship. Given the fundamental role that solidarity assumes especially in this particular and complicated historical period, volunteering becomes an indispensable tool for guaranteeing and promoting social inclusion and cohesion. For these reasons, I strongly supported this text, which calls on the Commission to take various measures to encourage voluntary service, including better communication of opportunities and better coordination to simplify bureaucracy. Furthermore, maximum support is expressed for the initiative launched in September by the European Commission for a "European Solidarity Corps", a body that should better manage the participation of young volunteers, without compromising existing volunteering programs and their funding.

name: Michel Dantin (PPE)
text: in writing.- This resolution is about improving European voluntary service.Since its creation, around 100 million citizens have participated in voluntary actions in the fields of education, culture, sporting and humanitarian events.The resolution considers that there is a need to deepen the system so that young Europeans can take full advantage of volunteering in order to gain useful experience in the labor market.MEPs consider, among other things, that citizens of all ages should be able to benefit from this program and that a better communication policy on European volunteering offers should be put in place.Considering that volunteering is a real opportunity for young people in terms of personal development and employability in the labor market, I voted in favor of this resolution.

name: Rachida Dati (PPE)
text: in writing.- In Europe, nearly 100 million citizens of all ages are volunteers.I supported this resolution on European voluntary service because it supports the idea of allowing voluntary activities to benefit from Union grants as part of co-financing and encourages young people to engage in the service of others while obtaining aknow-how as well as a rewarding experience for the future.

name: Gérard Deprez (ALDE)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this resolution which calls for the abolition of the last obstacles to European volunteering. At present, despite the social and economic benefits of volunteering, both for individuals and organizations, participation in European voluntary service remains modest. This is why the European Union needs a better coordinated policy on volunteering. Citizens of all ages, especially young people, must be able to take advantage of this system in order to develop their skills and gain experience which will be useful to them in the labor market. To this end, it is in particular essential to establish a clear legal framework defining the rights and responsibilities of program managers and volunteers. Organizations should also be encouraged to strengthen their participation in programs in which volunteers are associated by allowing their work to be taken into account by Member States, such as co-financing of projects. This is not enough, however. It is essential that the European Commission improves its communication strategy and public access to information about the opportunities offered by European voluntary service, that a single point of contact in the institutions of the Union be set up and that a simpler application system be established.

name: Marielle de Sarnez (ALDE)
text: in writing.- European voluntary service is an initiative of the Union created twenty years ago under the Erasmus + program.It has enabled 100,000 young people, aged 17 to 30, to take part in voluntary projects abroad in the fields of culture, environmental protection or social assistance.The quality of the offer could be improved with the creation of more efficient support structures and financing solutions at European and national level.Because it embodies the European values of solidarity, social integration and human personal development, European voluntary service is a formidable means of promoting European citizenship among young people.The Union must promote it.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (ENF)
text: in writing.- While the development of volunteering is commendable, the European Union does not have to use this issue to secretly defend an ever more extensive integration policy and strengthen its own skills.In addition, it is feared that, like Erasmus +, volunteering may be misled to be used as a school for "future posted workers" from Europe.Also, I voted against this text.

name: Ангел Джамбазки (ECR)
text: In written form. - I supported the joint resolution of the political groups on European Voluntary Service and on the promotion of volunteering in Europe, despite a few remarks, but in the name of consensus. I do not think that we should force the Member States to define a legal environment for volunteering, because each of them should decide for themselves whether or not to do so, but since the word 'encourages' is used in the resolution, I decided that to support this resolution, which can only reinforce the importance of volunteering. Hopefully more young people want to participate in such activities and the funds set aside will be used correctly and efficiently.

name: Jill Evans (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, which calls for a better co-ordinated policy on volunteering. Many thousands of my constituents in Wales are engaged in volunteering in a wide range of organisations and projects. Giving them a proper legal status would help improve skills and encourage others to join in. The work done by volunteers should also count as ‘co-funding’ for EU grants.

name: Fredrick Federley (ALDE)
text: written.- Recently, our time has been fraught with great tragedies, crises that put European cooperation at the forefront.Strengthening the legal framework for a single European Voluntary Service is in no way part of the necessary solutions in the future.The basis for volunteer work is its flexible and fast-paced character traits that enable organizations to mobilize and operate in a short time.Nor is it the task of the EU to assist the Member States with such a corps, but it should be up to each Member State to organize and implement.

name: José Manuel Fernandes (PPE)
text: in writing.- About 100 million citizens of all ages are volunteers and their work contributes to the production of approximately 5% of the EU's GDP.In 2016, the European Voluntary Service (EVS) celebrates its 20th anniversary and that, in these 20 years, 100 000 volunteers have received support.Volunteering is done freely, by choice and personal motivation, without the purpose of obtaining financial compensation.That said, it should be noted that volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and human development and is an essential instrument for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as for training,education and intercultural dialogue, while making an important contribution to the spread of European values.

name: Edouard Ferrand (ENF)
text: in writing.- Vote against: politically, it seems complicated to vote "against" a resolution on volunteering, widely considered by the population as a good idea.However, as usual, the European Union uses good sentiments and laudable ideas as a Trojan horse of an ever deeper integration policy and a strengthening of its powers.

name: João Ferreira (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - We value volunteering, as a contribution to the promotion of effective solidarity and mutual assistance among citizens, consolidating feelings of altruism and genuine generosity, contributing to social integration and the dissipation of feelings of discrimination. The report refers to concepts other than accompaniments, such as the concept of European citizenship, European civic service, or the European body of solidarity. It refers to the relevant role of volunteers in supporting the refugee humanitarian crisis. Valuing this participation, we cannot fail to denounce that those concepts and entities will contribute to legitimize and deepen a dynamic that has been used to take responsibility for the role that States and the European Union should have and do not assume, in the response to the very serious humanitarian crisis. Improving the development of volunteering also involves valuing and allocating support to the activity of non-profit organizations, among many others: the cooperative movement, local collectives and societies, residents' commissions, sports, recreational, cultural, youth associations or directed at childhood. Finally, it should be noted that volunteering cannot replace jobs, a practice that is unfortunately increasingly common, which justifies the need to strengthen its legal framework and the defense of its social rights.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (NI)
text: in writing.- I vote against the reports on the European Voluntary Service in their entirety, I do not think that any initiative regarding volunteering should have as its primary goal the integration and care of illegal immigrants.For me, it is more important to address the problems of Europe's youth first.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Year of Volunteering 2011 represented a major political opportunity to highlight the added value of volunteering in Europe. Volunteering is one of the most visible expressions of solidarity, which promotes and facilitates social inclusion, builds social capital and produces a transformative effect on society. I believe it should be further strengthened through a legal framework, regulating support mechanisms and establishing appropriate organisational structures. Member States that still need to define a legal environment for volunteers should do so through the use the recommendations in the Policy Agenda for Volunteering in Europe and the European Charter on the Rights and Responsibilities of Volunteers. Moreover, I support the call on the Commission to facilitate the development of a more coordinated European volunteering policy with a view to establishing a single contact point in the Commission, which would interconnect the individual initiatives and programmes and improve access to volunteering programmes.

name: Enrico Gasbarra (S&D)
text: in writing.- I welcome the question to the Commission from my colleague, Hon.Silvia Costa, who, on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the European Voluntary Service, intends to propose an eventual impulse to expand it, a valid tool for integration and social cooperation, training and an important opportunity for the development of the spirit of active citizenship and for thepromotion of European values.

name: Elena Gentile (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the European Parliament resolution on European voluntary service and the promotion of volunteering in Europe, because volunteering is an important manifestation of solidarity, freedom and responsibility which contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and personal human development, as well as it is an essential tool for social inclusion and cohesion, training, education and for the important contribution it can make to the dissemination of European values, hence the need to prepare a European framework for voluntary activities, which define rights and duties, and facilitate mobility and the recognition of skills. Twenty years after the launch of the European Voluntary Service, however, there are too many differences between EU Member States, some of which lack a legal framework for volunteers. I therefore strongly supported: first of all quick and easy access to the program, a simplification of the current application system, the importance of setting up a European framework for voluntary activities, defining rights and duties, and facilitating mobility and the recognition of skills, and finally encouraging Member States to promote European voluntary service in their education and academic systems.

name: Arne Gericke (ECR)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the resolution on European Voluntary Service because I think this instrument is very useful.In addition to the resolution, I call for the number of available jobs to be doubled to at least 20,000 in the coming year and for more money to be made available for this area - instead of up to EUR 3 billion for an absolutely pointless, free Interrail ticket for all 18-Year-olds to waste.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: written. - I voted in favor of the JMR on the European Voluntary Service and the promotion of volunteering in Europe since Podemos defends the values ​​of volunteering, solidarity, active citizenship and the mobilization of civil society in favor of the most vulnerable without chrematistic objectives. This JMR has highlighted aspects that are key for us, such as that volunteering should not replace formal employment, that volunteering systems at European level still lack adequate coordination and it is necessary to improve it or that fair funding is needed for its correct developing. The Resolution also values ​​the entire movement of volunteers during the refugee crisis who have known how to react to challenges with great pragmatism, and contemplates the possibility of recognition of volunteer status and improving access to information, recognition of acquired informal capacities. and a better communication strategy. That is why I think it is a good resolution and vote to consolidate this Service.

name: Theresa Griffin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this motion, which calls on the Commission to develop a more coordinated European volunteering policy. Volunteering is key towards building solidarity and responsibility, which contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and personal development. It is an essential tool for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as training, education and intercultural dialogue.

name: Sylvie Guillaume (S&D)
text: in writing. - This year we are celebrating the 20th anniversary of European voluntary service. One hundred million Europeans of all ages are volunteers whose work contributes 5% of Europe's wealth. Volunteering is a form of expression of solidarity which makes it possible to give flesh and substance to European citizenship by encouraging greater sharing of European values. The fact remains that this commitment is weakened by the absence of a legal framework in some Member States, including rights and responsibilities, and facilitating the recognition of skills. It is in this context that it would be desirable to adopt a European skills passport or Europass which would also make it possible to better recognize the skills acquired in informal or non-formal learning. It is therefore in this sense that I supported this resolution which also calls on the European Commission to a meticulous evaluation of its project of “European Solidarity Corps”, in particular as regards its added value compared to the work already committed by civil society and its funding, which must not cut the budgets already dedicated to other programs.

name: Antanas Guoga (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. In Europe nearly 100 million citizens of all ages are volunteers, whose work contributes to the production of approximately 5% of its GDP. Therefore, it is important that those Member States that have not yet done so have to establish adequately funded national voluntary service schemes and to improve access to quality information on volunteering opportunities at national and local level, in particular through existing information networks and peer-to-peer information.

name: Marian Harkin (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I was very happy to support this joint motion for resolution especially considering I was a founding member of the European Parliament volunteering interest group. Overall, the resolution is very balanced and I was happy that it noted the urgent need for better EU coordinated policy on volunteering, to give volunteers a proper legal status and help them join programmes. Almost 100 million EU citizens have taken part as volunteers in education, culture or arts, sport events, humanitarian and development aid work. Young people should take advantage of volunteering schemes to develop skills and acquire experience that helps them to find jobs afterwards. To encourage volunteering, a more supportive environment is essential, including a legal framework with clear rights and responsibilities for programme managers and volunteers, as well as fair funding. Thankfully, the resolution noted this. Likewise, I was very happy that the motion for resolution called for the European Commission to improve its communication strategy and public access to information about opportunities in the European Volunteering Service and also to develop a more coordinated volunteering policy, with a single contact point in the EU institutions and a simpler application system for both individuals and organisations.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the Joint Motion for a resolution on European Voluntary Service and the promotion of volunteering in Europe, because I believe that volunteering is one of the most visible expressions of solidarity that promotes and facilitates social inclusion, builds social capital and transforms society.The added value of volunteering should be constantly emphasized, as it contributes to the development of a vibrant civil society that can offer creative and innovative solutions to common challenges, is a key instrument for social inclusion and cohesion as well as training, education and intercultural dialogue.values.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)
text: in writing.- We have learned over time to see clearly through the actions of the European Union.Enough so that it occurs to us that once again good sentiments are being used here in favor of a policy of integration which I find misleading and excessive.Likewise, vigilance requires working to ensure that volunteering, like the Erasmus + program, does not facilitate posted work in Europe.I chose to abstain.

name: Petr Ježek (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the motion for a resolution on European voluntary service and the promotion of volunteering, because it is necessary to point out the importance of volunteering activities that people carry out in their free time and of their own free will, regardless of financial reward.I support the visibility of the benefits of volunteering, which revitalize and encourage civil society and democracy.It embodies European values, including solidarity, non-discrimination and the promotion of human rights inside and outside the European Union.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of my colleague Andrea Bocskor's report on European voluntary service.European Voluntary Service allows young people to participate in voluntary projects abroad fully funded by the European Union.A system which has benefited nearly 100,000 European citizens but which is encountering management difficulties.With this vote, Parliament calls for the legal framework surrounding the program to be clarified so that the possibilities offered by voluntary service are better known to the public.I am delighted that this report was adopted by a large majority.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: written.- I support the idea of the European Voluntary Youth Service and the proposals in this report.It is up to the Member States to raise awareness of this service and improve the conditions for application procedures so that it can also gain popularity among the general public.

name: Afzal Khan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the resolution as the EU needs a better coordinated policy on volunteering, to give volunteers a proper legal status and help them join programmes.

name: Gilles Lebreton (ENF)
text: in writing.- I abstained, because the "volunteering" framed by this resolution is the Trojan horse of an ever more advanced European integration policy.

name: Marine Le Pen (ENF)
text: in writing.- I abstained on the resolution on European voluntary service.Rightly, volunteering is seen as something noble and positive.However, as usual, the European Union uses good sentiments and laudable ideas as a Trojan horse of an ever deepening policy of integration and strengthening of its powers.It is also to be feared that, like Erasmus +, volunteering may be misled to be used as a school for "future posted workers" from Europe.Finally, the desire to appeal to the good feelings of the citizens of the Member States to deal with the stagnation of the refugee crisis for them is unacceptable.

name: Javi López (S&D)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this resolution, on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the European Voluntary Service (EVS), it highlights the many advantages and benefits of this volunteering program and poses a series of questions to the European Commission on how to improve it, bothaccess to initiatives as well as awareness and greater dissemination of them.It also deals with the initiative recently launched by Juncker for a European Civic Service.

name: Paloma López Bermejo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- Although I recognize the social value of volunteering, I have not been able to vote in favor of this resolution since it advocates a mercantilist consideration of European volunteering (which is quantified at 5% of GDP) which is used as a substitute for social services that mustbe public.I consider the voluntary work of thousands of citizens and residents of the Union laudable and as such must be socially recognized, but I oppose that volunteering serves as a pretext for the State to disregard its responsibilities, such as for example in the reception ofrefugees, which is the line in which the resolution is directed.For this reason, I have not been able to vote in favor of it.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: in writing.- I voted against.The resolution recognizes that "volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility", but calls for "volunteering to be co-financed by European grants" and calls on the Commission to develop a "more coordinated European policy forvoluntary activity ’.In my opinion, volunteering should remain voluntary and we do not need any European policy or European subsidies for it.

name: Monica Macovei (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ A culture of volunteering is beneficial for society as it addresses civic and social concerns and contributes to a vibrant civil society, and in turn a healthy democracy. Volunteering is above all a free choice, through which individuals can building solidarity with communities. It also has benefits at the communal level, in terms of building social capital and transforming society. Therefore, I support this resolution’s call to create a legal framework that identifies the rights and responsibilities of volunteers and volunteering. Such a framework will help protect volunteers and embed volunteering as a norm in society. This resolution as ultimately volunteering is the responsibility of the population. Volunteering is a matter of human kind and calls for deeper investments should come primarily from citizens themselves. Caring, sharing, helping and getting involved are much more than a choice, they are our duties as citizens, and they must be driven by our hearts and minds, from our human and financial resources.

name: Ivana Maletić (PPE)
text: written.- Volunteering is one of the most visible forms of solidarity which promotes and facilitates social inclusion, builds social capital and contributes to the development of a successful civil society.Volunteering as such helps to acquire skills and abilities and should be recognized as an informal and non-formal education.In Europe, almost 100 million citizens of all ages volunteer, generating 5% of Europe's GDP.The resolution emphasizes the importance of providing a European framework for volunteering as a legal framework setting out the status of volunteering with rights and responsibilities and facilitating mobility and recognition of skills.So I voted positively.

name: Vladimír Maňka (S&D)
text: in writing.- The volunteer service has positive effects on all its actors.It is an expression of the solidarity and responsibility of those who exercise it, and at the same time a real help to those to whom it is provided.At the same time, it is a means of mutual education and cooperation, through which many social, societal and ecological needs and problems of today's world are addressed.I support the motion for a resolution calling for the collection of country data on volunteering in order to develop comparable European indicators and methods for measuring the social impact of volunteering.By introducing a system of measuring economic value, it will be possible to better understand not only the human dimension, but also the economic benefits of this activity.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (ECR)
text: in writing.- I abstained from voting on the joint motion for a resolution on European Voluntary Service and the promotion of volunteering in Europe, as it is not sufficiently substantiated, and for the reasons I gave in detail in my speech to the European Parliament on 27 October 2016.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: in writing.- I abstained for this motion for a resolution.This text sets up a positive initiative which encourages volunteering among young people.This volunteering allows them to have more easily a first professional experience, which we are very favorable to.However, this motion for a resolution, as well as European volunteering as it is, poses several problems.First of all, we believe that the European Union is using the good feelings of its citizens to strengthen its skills and push its integration policy.Moreover, European volunteering, like several initiatives funded by the EU budget, is one of the sources of fraud used by some companies.Finally, we feared that European volunteering would become a school for "future posted workers" from Europe, which we are opposed to.There are already more than 300,000 in France.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - This resolution supports volunteering and European voluntary associations. In France, we distinguish volunteering, by definition unpaid, from volunteering. The latter supposes a commitment over a defined period and a remuneration, at least an expense, for civic actions. The resolution encourages European countries which do not yet have such a legal framework to do so, benefiting the rights of volunteers. Our program proposes to go even further and create a genuine compulsory citizen service in France. For military tasks but also of general civilian interest (firefighters, environmental protection, etc.) and paid at the minimum wage. But what is problematic in this report is the underlying logic: solving unemployment by promoting volunteering. And in particular to absolve itself in the humanitarian refugee crisis with the creation of a "European Solidarity Corps". The idea launched by Juncker is basically to encourage young people, populations in difficulty, to help other populations in difficulty, via associations, in particular which work with migrants. All almost free of charge. Frontex beats up migrants and young people will put on the bandages. Deeply iniquitous! I vote against, just as I will vote against Juncker's legislative proposal when it is presented to us.

name: Nuno Melo (PPE)
text: in writing.- In 2016, the European Voluntary Service (EVS) celebrates its 20th anniversary and that, in these 20 years, 100 000 volunteers have received support.Volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and human development and is an essential instrument for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as for training, education and intercultural dialogue, whilewhile making an important contribution to the spread of European values;stresses that its benefits are also recognized in voluntary actions carried out with third countries, as it is a strategic tool to foster mutual understanding and intercultural relations.Hence my vote in favor.

name: Roberta Metsola (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution, which stresses the need for volunteers to be given proper legal status and also aided in their efforts to find programmes.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: in writing. - In 2016, the European voluntary service celebrates its twentieth anniversary. During its 20 years of existence, 100,000 volunteers, aged 17 to 30, have benefited from its support. Volunteering is a major force in our civil society. This has added value as an expression of solidarity, which values ​​and facilitates social integration, contributes to the construction of social capital and has a transformative effect on society. Volunteering must also be recognized as part of economic capital as it contributes to the economic growth of the Union. I strongly support this kind of enriching initiative which gives the volunteer candidate the opportunity to do work on himself, as part of a participatory and collective work in the service of society. However, I remain convinced of the need to improve the communication strategy on the humanist values ​​of such a service. It would be a failure to reduce this program to the possibility of free travel across Europe. To avoid this kind of drift, we need a clear, appropriate framework defining the rights and responsibilities of volunteers.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of this resolution, which stresses the importance of volunteering and recognises its values and importance. Volunteering is an expression of solidarity which promotes and facilitates social inclusion. We need to promote creative and innovative solutions to common challenges, emphasising the need to have a combination of support mechanisms and appropriate structures that strengthen the legal framework, identifying the legal rights and responsibilities for volunteers.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: in writing.- The S & D, PPE, GUE / NGL, ALDE, ECR and Verts / ALE Groups have tabled motions for resolutions.The six political groups reached an agreement and a joint compromise motion was drawn up.I voted in favor of the compromise proposal.

name: Bernard Monot (ENF)
text: in writing. - The draft resolution follows the statements made by Jean-Claude Juncker in his annual speech on the state of the Union of September 13, 2016. It calls for the establishment of national legal frameworks with regard to volunteering, that volunteering be recognized as an informal skill acquired and valued in the context of job search. Access to European funds for voluntary organizations would be facilitated. He also recalls the importance of volunteers, especially in the management of the refugee crisis. He wants the creation of a European civic service. If the idea sounds good, as usual, the European Union uses good feelings and laudable ideas as a Trojan horse of an ever-deeper integration policy and a strengthening of its powers. It is also to be feared that, like Erasmus +, volunteering will be diverted into the schools of "future posted workers" from Europe. Finally, the desire to appeal to the good feelings of citizens to deal with the stagnation of the refugee crisis for them is unacceptable. Consequently, it is not possible to vote on this report.

name: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar (PPE)
text: in writing. - Volunteering is an expression of solidarity that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship, human development and is essential for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as for training, education and intercultural dialogue. I advocate the creation of a European framework that frames voluntary actions and that determines rights and responsibilities, as well as facilitating mobility and the recognition of skills. I endorse the rapporteur's position in asking Member States to implement concrete validation processes under the 2012 Council Recommendation to ensure a better understanding and comparability of skills and experience, as well as any future passport-related initiatives European Skills and Europass attach greater importance to volunteering as informal and non-formal learning. I believe that it is important for Member States that have not yet done so to create national voluntary service programs that are adequately funded and to improve access to quality information on volunteering opportunities at national and local level. MS should promote EVS in their educational and academic systems as a tool for disseminating education for solidarity and civic participation among young people.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this text on European voluntary service.This system, integrated into the Erasmus program, allows young Europeans to participate voluntarily and free of charge in activities in many fields (sport, culture, etc.) in a country of the European Union or a neighboring country.Since its creation 20 years ago, it has already provided support to 100,000 volunteers.In a world that is experiencing an increasingly globalized economy, it is important for a young person to be able to open up to new cultures and to discover new languages.

name: József Nagy (PPE)
text: in writing.- This European Voluntary Service is a well-functioning tool of the European Union to encourage young people to take an active part.Volunteering has become a real trend among young people and thanks to the EU program, everyone can get involved.The European Voluntary Service provides accommodation, meals and pocket money, as well as reimbursing volunteers' travel expenses.This way, young people can try themselves in a new situation where they are helping others and developing their own skills at the same time.In recent years, the importance of the experience gained through volunteering has also increased in the eyes of employers, which has further helped the employment and living standards of people from disadvantaged social backgrounds.I think this is a great opportunity that no one should miss out on!

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Voluntary Services (EVS) helps young people travel abroad to participate in volunteering projects whilst experiencing different cultures, making new friends and helping others learn new skills. I have voted for this motion for a resolution regarding the EVS, which that recognises the expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility that it offers.

name: Norica Nicolai (ALDE)
text: signed up.- I support this motion for a resolution on the creation of the European Voluntary Service, as I believe that encouraging this type of civic service is in fact an opportunity to develop human connections that help social inclusion, understanding and acceptance of cultural differences between citizens..I believe that this form of informal learning plays a major role in the development of open and tolerant societies, prepared for the new challenges we face.In this regard, I support the idea that volunteering, practiced by so many people throughout the European Union, be recognized as a learning and development activity and be supported by specific programs by both the European Commission and the Member States..

name: Luděk Niedermayer (PPE)
text: in writing.- Undoubtedly, it is worth emphasizing that volunteering contributes to strengthening active citizenship and personal human development and is an essential tool for social inclusion and cohesion, training, education and intercultural dialogue.I also supported the call for the European Skills Passport and Europass initiatives to give greater weight to volunteering.At a practical level, the Commission and the Member States should consider measures to ensure that time spent volunteering can be co-financed by European grants.

name: Franz Obermayr (ENF)
text: written.- I have abstained from voting on this report because a 'voluntary service' is basically a very important and significant thing, but I believe that the legal framework for the service needs to be changed.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I supported.Volunteering helps to strengthen active citizenship and personal development, so the resolution calls for more pan-European opportunities and a framework to facilitate volunteering.

name: Δημήτρης Παπαδάκης (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Union needs a better coordinated policy on volunteering and needs to give volunteers an appropriate legal status to help them join programs. Nearly 100 million citizens of the European Union have volunteered for education, culture, the arts, sporting events and humanitarian and development aid. Young people need to benefit from volunteering programs in order to develop skills and gain experience that helps them find work later. People of all ages should be encouraged to take advantage of volunteering to improve their skills but also to understand other cultures. The European Commission must propose a European Statute on Volunteering to ensure that all voluntary organizations have the appropriate legal status and institutional recognition.

name: Κωνσταντίνος Παπαδάκης (NI)
text: in writing. - The EU not only does not recognize the right to permanent employment, but promotes anything that can replace it (flexible forms of employment, training programs). This is confirmed by the joint resolution on the European Voluntary Service, but also by the Commission's recent proposal for the so-called "European Solidarity Body". The resolution notes that volunteering "is not accompanied by the pursuit of financial gain" and that it "helps people to acquire qualifications and skills that can facilitate their access to the labor market", effectively recognizing the use of volunteerism for the benefit of working people. business groups under the pretext of "solidarity". After all, as the European provocatively states. Commission in its proposal for the "Solidarity Body", those who participate will either be paid with crumbs or will receive literally pocket money. With these plans, they try in vain to cover the nudity of social services by outsourcing to private sectors, such as health, welfare, reception and hospitality of refugees, where MKOs are already threshing. The people must turn their backs on those who "snatch the bread from their hands" and then appear as supposed supporters of "solidarity". They must step up their fight against the system that breeds and reproduces poverty and exploitation.

name: Gilles Pargneaux (S&D)
text: in writing.- I supported this resolution which calls on the EU to adopt a better coordinated policy on volunteering, to give volunteers a clear legal status and facilitate their participation.Despite the social and economic benefits of volunteering, both for individuals and organizations, participation in European voluntary service remains modest and the remaining obstacles must be removed.Citizens of all ages should be encouraged to benefit from volunteering in order to develop their skills, their understanding of other cultures as well as their chances of finding employment.

name: Margot Parker (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this non-legislative and non-binding resolution. The resolution called on the Commission to create new initiatives and expand the European voluntary service at the taxpayer’s expense. The UK has its own volunteering schemes in place, and we do not need another service at EU level.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing.- It must be borne in mind that volunteering has a considerable value as it represents one of the most evident manifestations of solidarity, which promotes and facilitates social inclusion, develops social capital and produces transformations in society;moreover, volunteering contributes both to the development of a civil society capable of offering creative and innovative solutions to common challenges, as well as to economic growth.Therefore, with regard to the proposal under consideration, I would like to comment positively.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: written. - Volunteering is an expression of solidarity that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and personal development and is key to achieving social inclusion, as well as training, education and intercultural dialogue. It also contributes to the development of a successful civil society that can offer creative and innovative solutions to common challenges and economic growth, thus building social capital and transforming society. As such, it should be supported at the local, national, but certainly European level. Since current volunteering accounts for about 5% of European GDP, it is clear that in economic terms it is important not to neglect it. But that support must not just stay in words. That is why I support this motion for a resolution because I believe that concrete steps are needed to support and facilitate volunteering. It helps to acquire skills and abilities and should be recognized as non-formal education - it should be encouraged in educational systems. National volunteering systems need to be explored in order to identify and change good practices and correct bad and inadequate ones. We must not limit the scope of volunteering only to young people, but we must also encourage active aging. Certainly, all of this is not possible if the system of access to volunteering is complicated. Therefore, a quick and easy approach to volunteering should be guaranteed through the simplification of the application system.

name: Tonino Picula (S&D)
text: written. - Volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and is a key instrument for social inclusion as well as for training and education. Volunteering also contributes to intercultural dialogue and the spread of European values. The S&D resolution emphasizes the importance of providing a legal framework that establishes the status of volunteering with rights and responsibilities for volunteers and facilitates mobility and recognition. In this regard, it calls on the Member States to carry out concrete validation processes in the framework of the 2012 Council Recommendation. It is important to take greater account of the knowledge acquired through non-formal education, including volunteering, because volunteering provides people with skills that facilitate their access to the labor market. I support the Commission's idea of ​​launching a new volunteering initiative - the European Solidarity Force, and emphasize that the Commission should involve volunteer organizations in the implementation of this initiative. European Voluntary Service should be based on quality volunteering offers and respect the Charter on Volunteering. The resolution emphasizes the importance of promoting European Voluntary Service among young people, and I believe that European Voluntary Service should be based on a structure that allows young people to access the program quickly and easily.

name: João Pimenta Lopes (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - We value volunteering, as a contribution to the promotion of effective solidarity and mutual assistance among citizens, consolidating feelings of altruism and genuine generosity, contributing to social integration and the dissipation of feelings of discrimination. The report refers to concepts other than accompaniments, such as the concept of European citizenship, European civic service, or the European body of solidarity. It refers to the relevant role of volunteers in supporting the refugee humanitarian crisis. Valuing this participation, we cannot fail to denounce that those concepts and entities will contribute to legitimize and deepen a dynamic that has been used to take responsibility for the role that States and the European Union should have and do not assume, in the response to the very serious humanitarian crisis. Improving the development of volunteering also involves valuing and allocating support to the activity of non-profit organizations, among many others: the cooperative movement, local collectives and societies, residents' commissions, sports, recreational, cultural, youth associations or directed at childhood. Finally, mentioning that volunteering cannot replace jobs, an unfortunately increasingly common practice, which justifies the need to strengthen its legal framework and the defense of its social rights.

name: Miroslav Poche (S&D)
text: in writing. - This year, the European Voluntary Service will celebrate its 20th anniversary. Around 100,000 volunteers have taken part in this project over the entire twenty years of its operation, which is, in my opinion, a huge success. I was very pleased to support the resolution calling on the Member States and the EU institutions to maintain the involvement of Europeans in the European Voluntary Service. I see volunteering as an expression of solidarity, which contributes to strengthening active citizenship and works against social exclusion, poverty, intolerance, racism, xenophobia, injustice and at the same time contributes to the dissemination of European values. We had the opportunity to see the benefits of volunteering, for example, in the current refugee crisis, when many volunteers were found who were willing to lend a helping hand. However, in order for volunteering to work better, it is also necessary to create a European framework that identifies volunteering with rights and obligations, thus facilitating the mobility and recognition of volunteers' skills.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European Voluntary Service (EVS) is a European scheme for young people aged 17 to 30, who participate in volunteering projects in organizations abroad for periods of two weeks to twelve months.The fields of action are varied: culture, environmental protection, educational or social assistance, etc.Above all, this commitment to serving others is a tool for recognizing the learning achieved by the young person concerned.I voted in favor of this resolution which underlined the importance of consistent funding and a clear legal framework for both volunteers and program managers.

name: Paulo Rangel (PPE)
text: in writing. - It is with great pride that I highlight the celebration of the 20th anniversary of the European voluntary service (EVS), a European program that supported more than 100,000 young people in their noble and solidary decision to volunteer. Volunteering is based on individual will, choice and motivation, without seeking financial compensation. Volunteering contributes decisively to numerous social, human or environmental causes at European and international level. It is important to remember that, when volunteering, participants acquire a different set of skills that should be recognized as non-formal education. In order to allow EVS to continue to grow, it is necessary to guarantee the strengthening of mechanisms and intermediate structures through a legal framework that identifies the rights and responsibilities of volunteers as well as the organizations that receive them. I support the idea of ​​simplifying the application process for EVS programs in order to facilitate and speed up the process, as well as allowing more young people to participate in these types of programs. For the above, I support this report.

name: Julia Reid (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this non-legislative and non-binding resolution. The resolution called on the Commission to create new initiatives and expand the European voluntary service at the taxpayer’s expense. The UK has its own volunteering schemes in place, and we do not need another service at EU level.

name: Christine Revault D'Allonnes Bonnefoy (S&D)
text: in writing. - At the plenary session on October 27, 2016, I voted for the European Parliament's resolution on European Voluntary Service (EVS). The European voluntary service has already supported more than 100,000 volunteers in education, culture, sporting events and development aid. It is a real tool at the service of European youth and the intermingling of cultures in Europe which must be strengthened and supported. I welcome the fact that this resolution advocates the extension of EVS to all people, regardless of their age, to all fields of work and to all destinations, in particular in order to encourage the mobility of all volunteers in the field of management of humanitarian crises. I also fully support Parliament's demand for a legal status for European volunteers. Finally, I supported this resolution to encourage the Commission to facilitate the rules for the participation of companies and associations through, in particular, a simpler application system. The Commission will also need to take into account Parliament's recommendations to allocate more funds to more ambitious volunteering programs at European level.

name: Sofia Ribeiro (PPE)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor, since volunteering is a key aspect of active citizenship and democracy, as well as personal training, which embodies European values ​​such as solidarity and non-discrimination, also contributing to the development of participatory democracy and to promotion of human rights inside and outside the EU. This Resolution, among other things, urges national, regional and local authorities to ensure adequate funding, to simplify administrative procedures and to provide tax incentives for voluntary organizations and networks, especially small ones with limited resources. . Stresses the need to improve monitoring and strengthen the local dimension after a voluntary experience abroad, through support not only before departure, but also after return, in terms of post-orientation and post-integration training. In addition, he insists on the need to provide quality mentoring throughout the process through responsible management of the volunteers and raising the awareness of the latter to their own responsibilities in relation to the organization and the community.

name: Liliana Rodrigues (S&D)
text: in writing.- Mr President, volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and human development and is an essential instrument for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as for training, education and training.intercultural dialogue, while making an important contribution to the spread of European values.Its benefits are also recognized in voluntary activities carried out with third countries, as it is a strategic tool to foster mutual understanding and intercultural relations.It is important to establish a European legal framework for volunteering actions that defines a voluntary status, with rights and responsibilities, and that facilitates mobility and the recognition of skills.

name: Inmaculada Rodríguez-Piñero Fernández (S&D)
text: written. - On the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the European Voluntary Service (EVS), the advantages and benefits of the volunteer program are raised, as well as a series of questions on how to improve it, both in terms of access to initiatives and a greater number of them . Volunteering is one of the most visible expressions of solidarity, which produces a transforming effect in society, through the construction of social capital and social inclusion; in addition to being an expression of freedom and responsibility, it puts European values ​​into practice. However, for this to be carried out, the support mechanisms and organizational structures must be strengthened, through the reinforcement of an appropriate legal framework that determines the rights and responsibilities of volunteers. Follow-up and the local dimension should also be strengthened after a volunteer experience abroad by supporting local communities. That is why I voted in favor of this resolution for the elaboration of a coordinated European volunteering policy and for EVS to receive a greater boost from the institutions.

name: Claude Rolin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of legal recognition of the status of European volunteer, because volunteering represents a rewarding experience and ... experience to be valued.These activities bring the European spirit to life in its most concrete form.It is the expression of solidarity, of citizenship that does useful work, it is openness to the world and to others.These voluntary experiences contribute to mutual and intercultural understanding, which is why mobility projects like this one and those of the Erasmus + program should be developed and financially supported.

name: Bronis Ropė (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing.- I unequivocally support the commitment of the EU Voluntary Service and the proposed operational guidelines.It is a great initiative and a great tool that can not only help to address long-standing social problems, but also to meet the challenges of increasing social sensitivity, employment growth and even the emergence of new businesses.

name: Fernando Ruas (PPE)
text: in writing. - In 2016, the European Voluntary Service (EVS) celebrates its 20th anniversary and the number of 100,000 volunteers (who have already joined this program). Volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility - and often self-denial, which contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and human development, and is also an essential instrument for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as for training, education and intercultural dialogue, mobility and, at the same time, the dissemination of European values. In Europe, around 100 million citizens are volunteers, a job that represents 5% of the EU's GDP, so this economic value must be taken into account. For this reason, it seems to us fundamental to establish a European legal framework for these actions, defining the status of volunteering, with rights and responsibilities, which aims to facilitate mobility and the recognition of competences, together with a more coordinated European volunteering policy. In addition, Member States should promote appropriate national programs, improving opportunities and conditions for volunteering. As I agree with this proposal and believe in the incalculable social, human and civic value that volunteering adds to the people and organizations involved in it, I voted in favor of this report.

name: Tokia Saïfi (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this resolution which calls for a more coordinated policy on volunteering.European voluntary service allows young people aged 17 to 30 to participate in projects in organizations abroad for periods ranging from two weeks to twelve months.Participation in European voluntary service remains modest, 100,000 young people over the past 20 years;it is therefore urgent that the last obstacles be removed.In this sense, this resolution calls on the Commission to improve its communication strategy and to facilitate public access to information on the possibilities offered by European voluntary service.This resolution underlines that European citizens must benefit from volunteering in order to develop their skills and their understanding of other cultures as well as to strengthen their employability.

name: Lola Sánchez Caldentey (GUE/NGL)
text: written. - I voted in favor of the JMR on the European Voluntary Service and the promotion of volunteering in Europe since Podemos defends the values ​​of volunteering, solidarity, active citizenship and the mobilization of civil society in favor of the most vulnerable without chrematistic objectives. This JMR has highlighted aspects that are key for us, such as that volunteering should not replace formal employment, that volunteering systems at European level still lack adequate coordination and it is necessary to improve it or that fair financing is needed for its correct developing. The Resolution also values ​​the entire movement of volunteers during the refugee crisis who have known how to react to challenges with great pragmatism, and contemplates the possibility of recognition of volunteer status and improving access to information, recognition of acquired informal capacities. and a better communication strategy. That is why I think it is a good resolution and vote to consolidate this Service.

name: Maria Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- Although I recognize the social value of volunteering, I have not been able to vote in favor of this resolution since it advocates a mercantilist consideration of European volunteering (which is quantified at 5% of GDP) that is used as a substitute for social services that mustbe public.I consider the voluntary work of thousands of citizens and residents of the Union laudable and as such must be socially recognized, but I oppose that volunteering serves as a pretext for the State to disregard its responsibilities, such as for example in the reception ofrefugees, which is the line in which the resolution is directed.For this reason, I have not been able to vote in favor of it.

name: Remo Sernagiotto (ECR)
text: in writing.- It is our duty to recognize the social and economic value of the goods and services provided by volunteers, which in Europe amount to nearly 100 million citizens and which contribute to the production of around 5% of GDP.Volunteering activities, in addition to promoting the values that are the basis of ethical and supportive social development, have important positive effects and great potential in terms of social inclusion, employment, education, skills development and promotion of active citizenship.I therefore voted in favor of the resolution which on the occasion of the celebration of the twentieth anniversary of the European Voluntary Service correctly reiterates the need to promote volunteering more effectively throughout the EU, removing the obstacles that still exist that prevent volunteers, directly or indirectly.to make their valuable contribution to society.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this motion which calls on the Commission to facilitate the development of a more coordinated European volunteering policy. The European Voluntary Service (EVS) celebrates its 20th anniversary and 100 000 volunteers have been supported over those 20 years. Volunteering is an expression of solidarity, freedom and responsibility that contributes to the strengthening of active citizenship and to personal human development. It is an essential tool for social inclusion and cohesion, as well as training, education and intercultural dialogue, while making an important contribution to the dissemination of European values. Its benefits are also recognised in voluntary work carried out with third countries as a strategic tool for fostering mutual understanding and intercultural relations.

name: Branislav Škripek (ECR)
text: in writing.- In the case of the resolution on European Voluntary Service and support for volunteering, I voted in favor of it.Indeed, volunteering not only provides important added value in terms of solidarity and aid in Europe, but also makes a significant contribution to the growth of the European economy.

name: Monika Smolková (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Year of Volunteering 2011 was a crucial political opportunity to highlight the benefits of volunteering in Europe. People volunteer freely, at their own discretion and for their own reasons, without seeking financial gain. Volunteering has great value and importance and is one of the most significant expressions of solidarity. Today, almost 100 million citizens of all ages volunteer in Europe, and their work contributes to around 5% of EU GDP. It is therefore necessary to support and implement the proposal so that time spent on volunteering can be co-financed under European grants. There is also a need to cover volunteering with a common legal framework that will determine the status of volunteering, including rights and obligations, and allow for the mobility and recognition of skills and knowledge. Developing a more coordinated European volunteering policy would link initiatives and programs and improve access to volunteering programs.

name: Ivan Štefanec (PPE)
